60zy623KKaLZ3tCR6e7xqg.text: I was very impressed by our bartender Brandy, we were in Las Vegas for a week had many bartenders while we visited there and Brandy was hands down the best bartender we had, she actually paid attention to her customers, way to go Brandy, thank you! Drinks were good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

plJlZG6UF15XmlEtYp2JFQ.text: SKIRT STEAK CHILE RELLENO. Order this and don't look back.   Came here with a bunch of the besties during our vacay in Vegas. Owww! One of our guys had said this place was good a couple nights before, so we had our final dinner here as a group. What a great choice! I Yelped once we were seated to see what other folks recommended, and saw a guy who recommended the chile relleno. Oh. Em. Jeezy. Such a good call. The grilled poblano pepper came stuffed with chopped skirt steak and a mix of potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, onions and cilantro. They topped it off with a Mexican cheese blend, sour cream, and fresh avocado. This was all served over a tostada (like a smaller corn tortilla) covered in pasilla salsa (which tasted like a mole), with a side of rice and beans (the beans were a version of pinto, cooked with bacon and chipotle sauce).   Everyone's meals were great: burritos, tacos.   We didn't indulge in the margaritas because we had Fat Tuesday plans afterward, but next time foooorrrrr surrrrrre.  Best meal I had in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the chili relano! Best ever.

e0fCiwuH5DytEBLDNhBNfg.text: Great spot in Vegas for lunch. Decent prices and the food quality and portions were great. Quick and efficient service here. Will definitely go back here when in Vegas.

eXwpfd8JQc2VNI3JMDMuPg.text: Great service and excellent vegan options! No matter what you like, you'll find it here. Ask for Regina, she's great!

oe-9FMMiwQXCO00LMWsH0A.text: Try the roasted corn!!! It's awesome! And they give great service!! Definitely will come back next time I'm in vegas!

Lb2Imsaw4aMqdTnfm9GPLw.text: Hussongs Cantina is awesome! By far the best Margaritas in town, and they definitely don't skimp on the tequila, they pack a punch haha. The live Mariachi's were incredible. Not only super talented and can play almost any request thrown at them but also act as the MC's and truly make this restaurant a one of a kind experience. Surf and Turf fajitas with Carne Asada and gulf Shrimp, sizzling in a chimichuri and citrus marinade are off the hook! Street style "Elote" is amazing too and free when you check in! If you're in Mandalay Bay, go here. Happy hour and football specials look like a bargain too but not available on Saturdays, next time.

-IwwsHNigXMFzD54R4UjLw.text: Food was ok. Didn't feel that the ratings displayed on the screen lived up to the food. At best a 2 star.  Oh well.

NbWLnIfGx6M-UMVF8gM4iw.text: Thank you thank you to Sigi our waiter at Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas. He took such good care of us and made sure we had a much better experience than we did at our last visit to the Boca Park location. He is an excellent waiter and the food was very well made as it normally is. We will go back to Boca park when Sigi is working there.

zyz47MffIkP7jGne0W5QQg.text: Best margarita on the planet by far!! They have an amazing group of people who work there who care about the service they provide to their guests. The carnitas enchiladas with green sauce is amazing, and I can't refuse the guacamole! There are 3 different choices, I've never been offered that at a Mexican restaurant! I recommend this place all day, everyday!

hvQKC9RIyBU7ryM4Me9-ug.text: Great place will visit again... Friendly place with nice people... Wasn't a planned visit and im glad we stopped in for happy hour...

8J1QlxTgnX8c8KF_DFW1Ew.text: Great vegan options!! Tasty margaritas!!!..if you are vegan for sure you should try the quesadillas..they have happy hours as well

TvnGoiwmELhkuk-qnuxqaA.text: Awesome place. Andy treated us Canadians like Gold. Will be going back again tomorrow.

C5xJhJnkWULaghjUkzKwyg.text: Warm chips & 3 salsas plus iced water as soon as we sat down - perfect, we were tired from our trip. Pizole, corn and guacamole for dinner - complete happiness. And our server was great.  The breakfast options look good.  Good prices.

Lw-Uq33G7bosw0hfWrjrtQ.text: This place was pretty awesome! Oliver our waiter was very inventive! And the manager Steve was very personable! We were a pretty big and needy table but they kept the pace and made sure we had everything we needed. The food was delicious! Love the bean dip!

0oW6ZgGDpRFQp692URnxFQ.text: Great vegan menu. Had to double check with the waitress to make sure the fish tacos were vegan. Great margarita as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan fish tacos? These rock! Great margaritas too!

1Z7EFiR7bEjCAVnkXxKCfg.text: I love eating here when I come to Vegas. It's located in the Mandalay Shopping Center so there's many fun things to do around here. My boyfriend and I are vegan and we enjoyed all our food so much! Not all restaurants can perfect vegan food but this one does. Service matches up too! Definitely try this place!

Z_gToPVeTAEAEf89twRB0w.text: This is the best place for Happy Hour at Mandalay Bay! Wonderful service and amazing tacos!

wxCa9aSgUqXH4SN96IENqw.text: Service was extremely slow and food was very bland.  .....waited 10 min for salt. This is not authentic mexican food, more like yuck tex mex food! The michelada my hubby ordered was good, which is the only reason I'm giving them 2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Smp7Uz0QOxYFX8lnooNMJg.text: Great service and good food! Sometimes all it takes is a friendly smiley server to improve the overall experience, and that's what we got! Their fried avocado tacos were pretty decent and they had pretty great salsa as well!

S-3sWVTmQu4sq2V0YrqRBg.text: My wife and I dined here for lunch and had Regina as our server. She was so informative of the menu offerings and suggested items for us. I had a carnitas burrito while my bride enjoyed the salmon. Both dishes were presented beautifully and were so tasty. Chips and salsa were great, I only wished for hotter salsa. The Original Margarita was delicious on the rocks. The location of this cantina being in the shopping area between two casinos made it nice as there was little noise and no noticeable smoke. Once again a shout out to Regina for her fantastic service.

mHrXD0bYsrVXiZRimIYOug.text: Walking by minding our own business, Hussongs crossed our path. Best happy hour selections, prices and service. Must try the Pueblano guacamole and pozole. Their food is great. Our bartender Jina was excellent. Must be here during the Mariachi's performance, I play music myself, but this guys are unique and great! Get your drink and food on before heading out into town.

H0A2o3sdrnbmgq9k0JbeAQ.text: This is my jam! The food is delicious and fresh. The service is prompt and friendly. Every time we arrive in Vegas (usually Mandalay Bay) we stop in for nachos to share with meat of your choice. The FRESH jalapenos are beyond delish with queso fundido. So yum! It's not a cheap place, but a great choice for some bar snacks and BULLDOG or a yummy lunch for a big day at the tables. My waitress even remembered me from my last visit! If they have the green pozole... Do not pass it up. BEYOND DELICIOUS. My compliments to the chef!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look how yummy and mini the sopes are!!! So delish!

zGaGLFuhOaEsLmznrHJjag.text: Had dinner at Hussongs last night. Had a total blast !! Was very impressed ... the service was awesome, the ambiance was so fun , the food was delicious, really enjoyed the "Rock n Roll Mariachis" !! I highly recommend this venue !! I don't I'll definitely be back soon

f2b-DKVFTXNJdsFVdATcZQ.text: Inside Mandalay Bay, near the shops, great place to get some pretty good food and some good Margaritas. Get the big version which lets you keep the big cup and share it and come back for refills if you live in this hotel or close. Salsa is fresh, the burrito I had was good and huge and the quesadilla was big too.

4-h_CBOi1xtbTMcNUEyHMA.text: Salsa is horrible, food bland, drinks overpriced. Portions small. Blueberry smash drink was tasty. Overall not worth the money. Other places better.

IoUVpeYlz5clgEUUFQqbCQ.text: Food is freakin awesome! Baja California Mexican food. There is a mariachi weekend nights that really get the party started! It's a fun environment with strong drinks. If you're on the strip I'd definitely go here. The service is great & managers are wonderful. Can't think of anything bad to say except it's a little small. Worth it!

TGwi94U80V4_9cb8rkVOAA.text: Had a great meal. Started off with the corn appetizer we ordered the speciality tacos, the salmon special and the tostada salad. Everything was delicious. Our server Oliver was knowledgable & courteous. Would definitely return next time.

X67Gm15tIX_IfgvOhmuhPw.text: After being seated for what seemed like a century, it took the waiter a while to finally take our orders. I ordered the flautas and my fiance ordered the carne asada. By the time we got our order, the food was cold. The unappetizing meat inside my dish was rubbery and the potatoes in the carne asada were hard. Needless to say, it was not worth the money we spent. Will definitely not be going back.

yKqeyMdfUo15R-obAIycnw.text: It was cool.  Kinda looks like the original Hussongs down in Ensenada, Mx but a ton more expensive.  Oh well, that's vegas for you.  I had a good time throwing a few back with my dad so all it all it was a fun afternoon.

YwxH_4V2-pGCnxBiVLYJNg.text: Maybe I just had an usually smooth experience here, but I loved it! I fully expected it to be douchey as hell, based on the whole marketing B.S...but I was really pleasantly surprised and will be back!  My experience was around 8pm on a Wednesday evening, we were seated immediately at a good table, the service was EXCELLENT and very attentive, and what I ordered was fantastic!  I had the huarache, which was fanTAStic. The meat was seasoned well and everything just came together perfectly. Even the chips & salsa they put out are amazing...some of the best tortilla chips I've had at a Mex place.  My friend had the carnitas platter, which he wasn't thrilled with but said it was OK. And we shared a pitcher of margaritas. I think the total tab was $70...not too bad, seeing as we had 3 small margaritas each, plus food.

A9SufBpOUI4jC9-SK0Txkg.text: Food is good. I would say it's an easy place to just grab something if you are in between Luxor and Mandalay Bay and don't know where to go.  They give you free chips and salsa. The BBQ salsa is fabulous. Staff is average.

wnfMn6Vennilypvmf2ppVA.text: Seriously bad service.  Nothing worse than a bartender with an attitude.  If I ask if we can pay and you reply "maybe" I'm not happy.  Our drink sat empty for a long time.  Too many places to chose from to put up with horrible service.

VTTf6NADM2clzEwKEq_QTw.text: Excellent service. Excellent food. Price is right. Free chips and salsa. Parents got free desert for anniversary. The mariachi singers are entertaining and excellent! Highly recommend.

_qOKHILVSS7qlwiJC1Pceg.text: The house tortilla chips were thick and not very good at all... they are just filled in a big popcorn machine up front rather than cooked to order and served warm and fresh. The salsa, on the other hand was tasty which made the former fact a real shame. We left them untouched. Unheard of.  Food was just okay. Same as the service. I ordered the vegan chile relleno with gardein beef tips. My friend ordered the vegan quesadilla, which came on a single medium tortilla served open faced?  I wasn't a huge fan of the rice and I love my rice. There was a lot going on on the plate, flavor-wise my dish should have been exploding. The flavor just wasn't there especially having had such delicious Mexican in southern Colorado. My avocado slices were not even ripe. It was hard not creamy as a good, ripe avocado should be.  I did like the beans.  Pay attention to things like how busy the place is... follow the crowd. Better off going to Slice of Vegas a few doors down where it's busy for good reason and you are sure to be impressed.

ooIvoyHW97I1T0_ePfjeOg.text: We love Amber!  She's the best bartender in the West.  Thank you, great meal!  We highly recommend the quesadilla and the chile relleno

5YXdM_u-rh6Y2f1c_HOoKg.text: Worst ever. If you ever want to find out what bad Mexican food tastes like, go ahead. I had checken fajitas. Worst ever! And for 4 people we paid $120 bucks. Have Subway instead. Much better.

gp9aI_WZZbCuwnhV4GfYJA.text: best place for a cali burrito!!! and awesome customer service! Really good traditional food perfect for a hangover lol

-po1gcV2YlvxOzjx4lGStQ.text: Celebrated my friends birthday tonight and they provided us with amazing service, the food was delicious and the live mariachi band was a blast! Highly recommend the mojitos and the ribeye tacos, I love this place! Will be back soon.

uwoysbaEnQBABnnSVzi0eg.text: Stopped here for a QUICK bite before our show. Everything was executed beautifully!!!  The food came out quick and tasted GREAT, the check was dropped off early to accommodate our need to get out early.   I want to revisit this place and have a slower meal to experience it in True fashion.

8h48R4q1MrMHIcj5isqzlw.text: Fun friendly atmosphere.  Good service. Good food.   Mariachi band to boot. Great casual dining.   Definitely come back next time in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wMikxhEzwM0EjjTW3YoJlw.text: I have been wanting to try this place in Vegas for a while. Finally we got to!  Oh my god. The portions are what I have to rave about first. We ordered the guac and it was GIGANTIC! And then they brought out three kinds of huge salsa bowls to go with it! I think I have photos... anyway, it was all delicious.   And a VEGAN MENU! Yesssssss! It's pretty hard to find a vegan-devoted selection at any mexican spot where we're from. I got the vegan breakfast burrito which had faux chorizo and faux eggs. So amazing. And adding the guac on it - woo.   I definitely love this place. And I'm glad there will be so many opportunities for us to come back, since our wedding ceremony is going to be at Mandalay Bay next year.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The free corn platter from checking in on yelp
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan breakfast burrito

dUArFtAafYXfp_4rWu6ZOg.text: Great for a large group. They really do a great job of taking care of you. Great service. And the mariachis are such a highlight. Definitely pass them a few dollars (or a lot if you do well in the casino that night) cuz they're totally worth it. The food is pretty standard fare, a notch or two above taco trucks but nothing spectacular. But really welcoming to our large group.

i0gEZEGfgKkZ_HsdRoezkw.text: Stopped by here for a solo lunch, had a wonderful experience. I was greeted by two very friendly hostesses, one of which sat me down right away. Jordan was my server and she was super attentive from the moment I sat down. I asked for food recommendations and I was very pleased with her suggestion. I got the chicken enchiladas with salsa verde--delicious. Portions are pretty big, so if you're not that hungry you can probably share a dish. Got the churros as my dessert and it was also delicious.   Would definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.

yOeVqjspoC8cEdtCky_2Og.text: The margaritas are super strong here so a great bang for your buck for alcohol. Do not get the tower though it isn't a great deal compared to the rest. The food is a little better than typical cheap Mexican. The mariachi band was a lot of fun  and really good.

JPiZJjGiYqUWbn00FhiTvw.text: Excellent service. The staff are exceptionally nice, talk with you, and make sure you are very well taken care of. The food is also delicious and authentic. The salsas and chips are addictive. And definitely try their margaritas. The margaritas are the very first original ones created and taste out of this world. You will not regret coming here for dinner or happy hour or any time of the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork enchiladas

xczzwhcz9GPg8nLqXQALwg.text: You have to love the rare find of great food at great prices on the strip.  We stopped in for a happy hour lunch and took advantage of the specials -- $3 tacos and half price margaritas.  Tequila and tacos can make for a fantastic meal and Hussong's did not disappoint,  both the chicken with grilled pineapple and the carnitas were properly tasty.  The margarita -- think sauza tequila -- was made with fresh ingredients and again, properly delicious. Good lunch with drinks for two, under $30 on the strip. I'd give them between four and five stars, and I will be back.

-txy4OduT9qYcbZVCezWww.text: Great place to visit for happy hour! The food was delicious and they gave us three options for hot sauce, awesome! Laid back atmosphere. Sarah our waitress was outstanding. I would recommend to check out for happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bdoPz5InlG4hDBadC7gT7w.text: Really excellent service from Luis! 5 stars for food as well. Would come back anytime!

iszBP8GssnQwS31H-PEGuQ.text: Very good food, friendly staff. Lots of vegan options! They also have gluten free options and aside from that everything else is delicious. A lot of options!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cantina!

UOG5NRJoza-JnnMVEqoorA.text: Well let me say that it started off ok but went south after that pretty damn quick . The guys that were playing the music we're pretty cool and the hostess was also very nice. Waiter took A very long time to come over and take our drink order and then after he did was nonexistent, finally ordered our food And we also ordered the corn for appetizers. The corn came but it was cold like it just came out of the fridge but we were hungry so we just ate it. My kid did not eat his though . My wife ordered a burrito and I ordered the chimichanga and When we received our food we both noticed that it was cold.. In all fairness the food did not taste bad just temperature wise it was not good. Waiter never came back to check on us or for refill our waters, Finally had had enough called manager over and told him the problem he was cool enough to comp one of the burritos and take the corn off the bill all in all bad experience

M3YRFEy2lg2GCn1CEKTLuw.text: Most disgusting quesadilla I've ever had. I come from Texas so I understand that you can get a very bad quesadilla like you can get a good one. But the one I've had at this place is beyound disgusting. I ordered the carnitas quesadilla and it came drenched in fat, it tasted like you took a bite off of a sponge soaked in frying oil, and the meat had absolutely no flavor at all. Just terrible. don't eat here.

Xe1y-RZwCK4WQNHYvrwX7w.text: Amber is awesome. Helped us find the perfect vegan options. Love this place. Wish we had a place like this in WV.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Relleno

N-EenSbmTQaXD3jG8EQAIA.text: Are here last night with a group from my conference and I was pleasantly surprised. We had a family style meal with enchiladas, carne asada, and salmon. They were very good. One of the members in our group had food allergies and they went out of their way to make special dishes for him.  My one complaint would be I wasn't a huge fan of their chips. Otherwise everything was great.   Side note. It was impressive they made a menu with our company logo.

jF2OxWJLSA59VBpt0Bgrfw.text: The original margarita was really good. The chips are fantastic. The guacamole was pretty incredible. It was really fresh. I ended up getting the shrimp stacked quesadilla. I wasn't a fan. I didn't like the crunchy "inside" quesadilla, and the shrimp weren't great. I did try my friends carnitas tacos and they were awesome. Our waiter was Ollie and he was a good dude. Also, if you check in on Yelp you get a free shot of tequila.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp stacked quesadilla. I didn&#39;t like the crunchy &#34;inside&#34; quesadilla. Everything else we had was great, but I didn&#39;t get pictures.

6j8DrAxKh7_7W_MaWsMqEQ.text: We came always the way down the strip just to come here, we had of course the Nachos, and the Margaritas. They are still amazing and they are at the top of my list for the best nachos I have had.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos

OhZPLFcLif7sgaSO6TVekA.text: Well this is our second visit and this time we brought friends to join in on the fun, what a great time and it was my hubbys bday, they made it so memorable, everyone need to try this place, waiter was great, the band that sang to us repeatedly was a hoot! If you haven't gone you have to!

lqd4jw8vftH848bmVT3i_g.text: Amazing food! Great vegan options! Luis made our experience one to remember. Can't wait to come back!

28LjQtvpo5XgzslixMNJQw.text: Man if yall in the mood for mexican food yall cant do any wrong by coming in and eating at hussongs!!!

9Z0SjWUxi8t-XYJXXooOAQ.text: Yeah that was terrible! My niece celebrated her 21st birthday dinner here last night, aside from the fact that you can barely have a conversation because the mariachi band is playing the whole time in the small confined restaurant. Several of my parties orders were incorrectly prepared, salmon was overcooked but requested as medium rare, one of the meals was requested to come without beans and it showed up covered in refried beans. We then asked the waiter to just remove it from our order because at this point we weren't interested in waiting any longer, however they still tried to charge us $20 for it.  My cheese enchiladas tasted like they rolled a string cheese into a quesadilla and served it = $16. They charge $20 for a burrito and an extra $8 to add Carne Asada meat. We had a total of eight people for our party so they automatically add gratuity to each check. Smh! This place does not uphold Las Vegas reputation or standards, very disappointed.

2VrK-4-ELUcTVD9K9lWZ2w.text: I am giving it a 3 star because wait staff was great and entertainment was amazing.  Food sucked violently.  I had some kind of shrimp pop corn on slaw.  It was repulsive.  The slaw' flavor tasted old. I could'nt take a second bite. Poor looking shrimp turned into pop corn were sad and tasteless yet fatty as possible.  Ron had a chicken burrito, dry on the inside, soupy on the outside.  I wanted to puke.  We stuck around because they had an amazing live band! One of the singer's voice is a pure baritone, a rare gem. Our waitress Sarah was wonderful as well

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

We came here twice during our Vegas stay and we tried the Chile Relleno, the chimichanga, the breakfast quesadilla and the stacked quesadilla (all vegan!). They were all amazing but I particularly recommend the stacked quesadilla and of course, the margaritas.

e12fyGmp6yQMbY87y529Jw.text: Great tacos, awesome service by Lacey! Thank you! I would highly recommend this place if you love margaritas and tacos.

XvGR3yuTsqLtxdJjdafEfw.text: The ambiance is perfect and in fiesta mode.  The food's good and the service impeccable.  Thank you Lacey for providing such a positive dining experience and welcoming attitude with your smile.  You are so patient ;-)  My whole family enjoyed dinner and hanging out as well!  We will definitely come back soon ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoyed their Michelada ;-)

ZW24DOCg8RCTNtn9ST-eGg.text: Went there on break today and they gave me discounts when they didn't have to! Loved the customer service and cleanliness of the location! Dave was an extreme pleasure to talk to! He was cheerful and happy to be serving! Definitely gonna be my go to

H-Z2XeXuWlvdehcvVqFbOQ.text: Great service and good food! I had the kale salad and it was tasty. Owner is very nice and hospitable. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ziJj0YntyStfth4DKWibjw.text: Aside from the super cool vibe, good music & constant chip refills, our waitress Stephanie has been the absolute best! Thanks girl!  Also, these cucumber jalapeno margaritas are LIT

1_4yhWc4AA1bWs7XI9PXWA.text: The original Hussong's in Ensenada claims to have invented the margarita. Hussong's Las Vegas actually has a vegan menu. These two factors are what prompted us to give this place a try on a Sunday afternoon.  We weren't hungry enough for full meals, so we sat at the bar. We decided to share a Stacked Quesadilla. I wasn't driving home so I ordered a margarita.  I don't know if they would recognize this quesadilla in Baja, but it was surprisingly tasty. If you've never tried Gardein Chick'n Strips, they taste remarkably similar to crispy fried chicken. I'm not sure what else was so flavorful (maybe the Pico de Gallo?) but we were both happy with the quesadilla and I would definitely order this again.  I also don't know how the margarita would pass muster. I got the Original, which came in a pint glass instead of a margarita glass. Is this how they serve them in Ensenada? Not bad, but I've had better. They claimed to use Sauza Blue Reposado tequila and fresh squeezed lime juice. If True, I could have used more tequila. Maybe I'm spoiled by my own margaritas. It was pretty refreshing, though, and deceptively strong. Maybe I'll try a Cadillac or El Pepino next time.  Thanks, Hussong's, for serving Gardein products. Vegan Mexican food isn't easy to come by, and you do it right!  Suggestion: serve some dishes with soyrizo!

Z6QYi_zLvSq4sk4JP3TJdA.text: Go here often. Love the atmosphere and the selections are amazing. Largest complete disconnect tonight was the service. The server seemed overworked and inexperienced. Inattentive and seemed to have a high level of anxiety as he was literally sweating more than what looked comfortable.   Took 12 minutes just to come around and introduce himself and take the drink order. Got the drink order wrong. We didn't get chips and salsa until  after was asked post-appetizer.   Overall long periods of not checking back and overall non-attentiveness to the customer. It was easy to spot out the manager on duty who was carelessly walking the floor and chatting with the female staff with little care or attention to the problem areas.   Not the best show for a restaurant of such high traffic on a Friday night.

9nyL4qcc_hJ2YWvDTCUjhA.text: Get a pitcher of margarita's, a quesadilla and call it a day!  LOL  Not the best quesadilla I've ever had, but if you have enough of the margarita you won't care!!  The service was pleasant and the mariachi band awesome!!  I'm sure I will be back soon to this Mandalay Bay staple.

hgkC8AQpTAdyjDxX7STPrg.text: Service is great and so is the band but the food is bland and extremely over priced. Out of all the places I ate out in Vegas this was by far the worst in taste.

HEv0OYuY-7k5zjUi9ZzTtw.text: Had a super fun time tonight at Hussons.  The decor and vibe are hip, and good selections on the menu.  Our server, Luis started us off with Sriracha shrimp...fantastic flavor, guacamole which was chunky and flavorful, chicharones...super crispy with a nice spice blend.  All the appetizers were done very well.  Our group then ordered various tacos which were all very tasty...some of the standouts were the rib eye, carne asada, pork belly, and baja shrimp.    One person got the chicken nachos which were huge and smothered with cheese-they were tasty.  Our server was attentive, nice and helpful...his name was Luis.  We would definitely eat here again.

UyiR0GRt3NffcZ-pihKfVg.text: I love this place when you check in you get a free corn or shot of tequila. Thanks Oliver of I got a shot. Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MsgzI3whzOyWxcgNWsPugQ.text: I checked out Hussong's vegan menu right after I had just finished stuffing my face at Slice of Vegas next door, plotting my next evening's meal with the family. I ordered the vegan chile relleno stuffed with Gardein beefless tips which was delicious and also a little spicier than anticipated, but I really wanted to order something that I couldn't get in Portland. I ended up asking for some vegan sour cream to try to tone down the spice, which helped. While I was eating the chile relleno, I knew I was going to pay for it later and did end up buying some Tums to take to our show! It was worth it though. My sister had the tostada salad with Gardein beefless tips and seemed to really like it. The chips and guacamole were great too! I would definitely eat here again and it's worth the trek out to Mandalay Bay on the strip. Thanks for offering such a great vegan menu, Hussong's!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tostada salad with beefless tips
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan chile relleno

rvuwd2rjeG6JobRuVmW7PA.text: This place is a hidden gem, some extremely good carnitas, and enchiladas. Between me and the wife we decided it was the best margarita we have had from a restaurant. Good environment, and overall nice place. Definitely plan to go back.

qWjT5x2KVtGTdacm9UYIBA.text: OMG!! Love this place. Stumbled in here because my husband wanted to watch the Packers game, and was pleasantly surprised with the Vegan menu that was phenomenal! Brandy was our awesome bartender, was amazing and made our dining experience even more amazing! Our whole party had a great time!!

U58rGHSaeU6OO-7Ei8COjw.text: Food is unbelievable, this is my second time here in Las Vegas and the service is always top notch. The only thing I suggest is not eating the sweet throw up after taste salsa when you get your chips! Definitely a spot to come in every time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XQTPGZLZim5DcJv5l4EOqw.text: I've been walking past this place for years. Dined here due to a surprise dinner reservation, and since have been back trying all of the vegan menu. There's actually multiple entree choices for vegans! So far all of the food I've tried has been delicious! Prices okay, Service good, vibe is a restaurant/bar (I prefer sitting in the back, not as rowdy), good mariachi band. But really I keep coming back for the variety of tasty vegan options!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan chili releno.

Styp6poPqNk4ecMmtA1_vw.text: Stopped by for a quick bite to eat on my lunch break and was extremely pleased, the food tasted great! Being Hispanic I am a very picky eater when it comes to Mexican food and I'm definitely going back for more. Very friendly staff, Chad the GM was very helpful and polite. Highly recommend!

nz0dRxCgRAfa112S8OgHOg.text: Phil was an amazing bartender !!!! My best friend and I love him he never disappoints us when we go eat there !!! He's just the best and the best drinks!! He makes one hell of a michelada !!! This place deserves ten stars because if him

omXVp6tvwi_BnUcpFXKgDw.text: Here is one of those restaurant I was very impressed with.  I was done with being at the Las Vegas Motor Speedway and wanted a good meal, but of course I did not want to pay a huge price for my food, plus I did not want to wait for a long period of time getting that food, as I was hungry at that moment.  I was walking to find that kind of place when I see Hussong's and decided to eat here and I was grateful that I did.  The waitress that was serving me, came up and introduced herself and asked if I wanted something to drink, this was very fast, plus as many tables she was serving she was able to get my drink back to me very fast.  It did take sometime for her to return to get my order, but of course she seamed to have plenty of tables she was working on and one big table was getting their food when I was ready to order, of course the chip and salsa were waiting for me to eat and I did.  The quality of the food once it arrived was very good, the freshness was outstanding and the time it took to get to my table was fast.  I enjoy the meal and look forward to returning back, especially for the good food, and especially for the mariachi singing country songs, that was what made my evening.  The only thing bad is I had order an appetizer and it never arrived, even after asking the waitress about that dish.  I was OK with that, as I did not get charged for that dish and everything was well priced.

jTS_gXRPJ1_bxgfEpRZ1sQ.text: Great good, great atmosphere. Located next to Boca Park. Def recommending!  Chris the waiting was very accommodating and offered great conversation

8lsHTTfLLFwaxJ2OiL4IjQ.text: This was a great change from other places we went in Vegas with poor customer service and snobby attitudes. Their service was great, and our waitress was so nice and attentive. They made a mistake with our order and were extremely apologetic and proactive about fixing it and giving us a discount before I even had time to complain. I appreciated their service and the food was great and great for vegetarians and vegans as well.

yYSG6VHy45D3vL9QC6xgWw.text: Trying to exit the casino to get some fresh air and some decent food (also not overly priced), we realized that there were no exit signs and the workers wouldn't give us correct directions out, so we settled for Hussong's. Our first entree after a long day of climbing was a plate of chicken nachos covered in some odd white cheese sauce. We scarfed them down, they didn't taste half bad going down but coming out was another story. We were sick the rest of the night and following day from food poisoning.  I went to go talk to the manager, face still pale I could hardly look in the restaurant, The manager basically said that no one else got sick so too bad for us. The best he could conjure up was "maybe" offering us some more food if we called some other number. I didn't want to risk throwing up again so I settled for this yelp review...   next time we'll stay at the camp ground instead of enter a land of greed driven frat party hell, all well vomiting.

IgDb1wK5aMkwT0CrvvOFLQ.text: big time meh. maybe 1.5 stars. only went because we were short on time for a show and had a credit on restaurant.com. we were seated immediately, but the server took almost 10 minutes before coming by. we ordered and she quickly brought waters. drinks took a little bit long. our ceviche appetizer came, delivered by another server, who noticed we still hadn't received chips and salsa. smh. ceviche was bland; the shrimp was not "cooked" in lime juice. I had to grab our server to get another beer. she was very inattentive and or overworked with too many tables. my lady had the chille rellano which was decent, but not great, even though I love skirt steak. I had the shrimp fajitas which were also just okay, although there was a good amount of shrimp. even after piling some of our plates at the edge of the table, it took another 10 minutes to get a dessert menu. next time we will go to Ri Ra with their awesome local discount.

Gc2V5M_nos1SrtU0zgez5A.text: I went here the other night with my friend who loves Mexican food. We went on a Saturday night, and they had a mariachi band playing the entire time which is cool, but it's not fun when you're trying to talk. Right when we entered, the server immediately brought us warm chips and salsa. It was pretty good. Although, I'm in a bit of a spicy kick right now, so I wish they were spicier. My friend ordered a chicken quesadilla, ad I ordered a carne asada burrito. My burrito was decent. I prefer Chipotle a lot more, and Chipotle is half the price. My friend's quesadilla was pretty tasty. The food wasn't bad nor was it amazing. It certainly wasn't worth the $30 for the two items. I don't think I'd ever go back again.

0C2dK2kDe1g9oZvBczmOdA.text: At the time I had lunch here, there was a foursquare checkin offer for a free plazero corn for checking into Mandalay Bay shops. Let's just say that my quesadilla lunch + my free corn had me in the food coma necessary to snooze away the rest of the day poolside so I could party the night away. And my lunch tab was under $10.00! More money for the slots and cocktails! Oh yeah, the ingenious "open face" chicken quesadilla allowed me the freedom to pluck off all the tomatoes prior to folding it in half to eat. I'm a fan of lunch at Hussong's (eventhough I didn't have one of their world famous margaritas)!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadilla served open face. $10.00
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips &amp; 2 salsas. Gratis.

rlVdQr9r8WeynG2hDlhtFQ.text: Vegan menu is delish. Tasted too close to the real thing to be vegan. Give food 5 stars, but prices are too high. Was seated and after 10 mins we had to actually ask for a waiter to take our order. The kid who helped us was good and took care of us with good service. He wasn't too much in the know of the vegan ingredients. Would recommend he learn a bit about that. I would recommend you try this place (speaking only on behalf of the vegan menu) if you're looking for some good Mexican vegan.

xkEe9mKQH-HTHNa2W85WTg.text: I didn't even know this place existed because it's always overshadowed by my desire to go to Burger Bar whenever I get this close to The Strip.  We had to meet some family for dinner at Mandalay and told them about Burger Bar's greatness.  Upon arriving we found out the BB was closed for a private event so we had to pick another place.  Since we didn't feel like walking more than 10 feet we decided on Hussong's.   The name might be a little off-putting as it doesn't scream "Mexican Food" and they claim to be the inventor of the Margarita.  Still, we gave it a chance and we were pleasantly surprised.  It was a little pricey for Mexican food but cheap for Strip standards.  The waiter did an okay job but was a little slow after we ordered.  My wife had Enchiladas and the rest of us had their Chicken Tostada Salad, which was pretty delicious!  They had two fried strips of Flour Tortilla that came along with the salad rather than a fried bowl and I was a big fan!  I did have a couple of problems with the place, however.  As I said the waiter was 'ok' but he constantly tried to upsell us stuff.  I hate when they offer you Guacamole like it's on the house when it really isn't.  I'm of the opinion that if you offer it, it's free.  We didn't bite.  The biggest thing that I didn't like was the fact that their Margarita's came in Pint Glasses.  Really?  You claim to be the Margarita inventor and you're going to put them in a pint glass? I don't think so.  That alone lost a whole star for me.  There was a pretty sweet Mariachi Band wandering around and they were playing some rock hits that you would expect from Mariachis.  Pretty cool.

m3mx3-u3jpWB9qU8ozE7pA.text: Margaritas are quite amazing. Mariachi singing "Don't Stop Believing". My life is complete.

ae_1UfEDNBG_zrDXrZe2Aw.text: This is one of my favorate mexican places. Mexican gets a makeover at this place! All i gotta say is..try the cassadia...its whatever meat you want on a open faced tortilla.with drizzled sour cream....its just excelent! and the margarittas are the talk of the town. Take a moment and drop by.

N4irq6Io3FYuzc7ttac2NA.text: Stumbled upon this place because we couldn't decide where to eat. The host let us know that a table was being cleaned and that we could grab a drink while we waited. I heard a trio playing in the background and immediately knew that we were going to have a great time here.   Our server was pretty good, she was attentive and took our orders right away. The chips and salsa were pretty good as well. I ordered nachos for my meal and shared them with a friend. While we were waiting for our food, the trio made its way to our table. They were a crazy fun time. Remixed classic mariachi songs with modern day music like LMFAO. We were having a great time listening to them.   The food came out and was pretty decent. The nachos were piled high with gooey cheese, beans, corn, and chicken. I also tried some of the quesadilla, which was loaded with carnitas, sour cream, and beans.   I would come back here again, had a great time.

vPMPjwvsVIHSrlM6rx9q3Q.text: I have to say, the margaritas are great. Every time I'm in Vegas I look for a great tasting margarita. I finally found it. The happy hour nachos are not bad either. You get complimentary chips and salsas which are great too.  However, I don't know if it's because of it being happy hour but the service was horrible. Our server took our order and we never saw him again until he brought us the bill. Never came to ask if we wanted to order another round of drinks or if we wanted more food or even to simply fill our water cups. It literally felt like it was just moving the masses in and moving them out as quickly as possible. Even if there are empty tables, expect to wait because they try to maximize seating, meaning there could be a table for four available but if you're a party of two you will have to wait for a table for two to open up.

B5hdpIBeYJR6WRpqqIrY5Q.text: It's a cool place if you want some drinks and a quick bite. Not family friendly.

05YrbEhN-5gM6j0srAWYhg.text: Wow... Food was awesome, service was great! I had the street tacos, the carnitas were tender and flavorful, my wife had a chicken salad and the chicken was cooked perfectly and seasoned great!  Oh yeah and the margaritas were real good too!

fhLQWW_QclxdqdihrHzfKg.text: The service, food and margarita's were quite smashing at Hussong's Cantina.   My friend I were seated very quickly and learned that they were only serving the late night menu.  We both ordered a burrito and margarita and enjoyed a most wonderful meal.    The server was very polite and took care of our ever need.

-184nf36E8y6hem35VUYrg.text: My wife and visited this restaurant twice during our trip and the food was great. Our server was Taigi and her customer service was great. The General Manager Chad Jahn came greet us at our table and he was very courteous. I highly recommend this restaurant as the customer service is excellent!!!

PKy6-R4VZUxorovemzfg4Q.text: The chips and salsa were excellent, but I can't really recommend anything else. The guacamole was bland, the chicken enchiladas were bland, and the rib eye tacos, while good, were quite small. On top of that, everything was overpriced (even for the Strip).

F4hA3-Ea3Y9RDROUKU40xg.text: Another restaurant with loads of fake "memorabilia" on the walls.  When I arrived, they walked me past a bunch of open tables to the table farthest in the back, right next to the constantly swinging kitchen door, and facing the table that was being used by the staff to fold napkins. If it were not for the fact that the busboy folding napkins had a great butt, I would have complained.  Later, when they found out that I am conducting one of the big shows in town, they offered to move me to a better table. I politely declined, (Too Late) but thought; "Ya mean if you'd thought that I wasn't your average customer, you would have given me a reasonable table?" Not good.  They advertise as "Not your standard gringo Mexican food place". But that's exactly what I found. The food was all very average. The tomatillo salsa that was served on my "Enchiladas Suizas" was the same that was served with the chips when I arrived. The chicken inside did not seem spiced or marinaded in any way. The tortillas were dull.  The margarita was good (made with fresh lime juice), but it was not "the original" margarita, as advertised. According to Hussong's history, the original was made with Damiana liqueur, which adds a slightly bitter, herbal flavor. Here, they substitute Cointreau, which is citrusy and very sweet - again, appealing to the average Gringo.  I've mentioned this before, but I'll bring it up again: Las Vegas is jam-packed with awesome Mexican restaurants - and most of them are dirt cheap. If you're gonna charge $16 for an enchilada, you'd better back it up with outstanding food; interesting drinks, and impeccable service.  I did not find any of those here.

7J-AB3uQ4wF8KqP6cOanVw.text: Went here for lunch upon arrival in Las Vegas. Husband and I were super hungry and thought Mexican food would hit the spot. Service was very attentive however the food was disappointing overall. Salsa was less than impressive, chips were good. I got the taquitos appetizer and for $8 they were disappointing. My husband ordered some kind of Angus tacos (3) with rice and beans. For $18 I expected tacos with some beef to them, they were about the size of the palm of my hand, very unsatisfactory. We will not be returning. Too much money for very little food, isn't Mexican food generally inexpensive?!

j6xuM8CmZ-eOgSPvnRicCg.text: Good food... great vibe ... friendly  Had the fajitas were very yummy  Had a margarita as well

P6CpKtScx_KLB1Hgcfmd9Q.text: Great Happy Hour and the Elote is amazing! I've always had a great experience and the bar tender makes the best margaritas ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour!!!!

Ctvu1w2gZ9ht2rDRWqHmcg.text: Great food and great service. The chips and salsa that come before the meal are yummy and the chips came out warm. We also ordered the cheese and guacamole, which did not disappoint. You can mix and match tacos and everything was so good. You will not leave hungry. Regina was our waitress and she was phenomenal. She was so friendly, prompt and organized. We never waited for anything and she was always smiling! Highly recommend this place!

BKMh862sx1asqdHTo1jVHw.text: Vegan menu!!  Everyone at my table enjoyed their food, meat included, but this is from my vegan point of view.   Order the habanero salsa if you like spicy.  I was so excited to try Hussong's once I saw they had an entire vegan menu and my meal did not disappoint!! 4 different types of vegan tacos, all on happy hour for $3 from 3-6pm.   Beware, the vegan chicken is like very realistic pork. I checked with several staff members who assured me it was vegan. The staff seemed knowledgeable and were very accommodating.   I got vegan beef, chicken, veggie and fish tacos and all were awesome. They use gardein products but the chefs are miracle workers.   Check in on yelp and you get a free street corn or tequila shot. I chose street corn and they even veganized it!!   Our waiter was awesome, friendly, and helpful. Overall a great experience for everyone at the table but especially me as a vegan.  I might return to Vegas JUST to eat and Hussong's again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 vegan tacos. Happy hour 3-6 $3 each!!
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan elote !!!! (Mexican street corn)

vyMq0wLvWxtxCcn8eirQIA.text: Excellent choice to go out of your way to find. Best margarita in Vegas, frozen or on the rocks. Make an effort to visit during Happy Hour. Deducted 1 star as beer should have been colder but manager assured me that they would remedy that.                       Mandalay Place, on the A/C covered bridge to Luxor

A-Dp1zUL6LXyRDFCwB7H6Q.text: Hussong's has my heart, even if the Mariachi band played Baby Shark and that damn song was stuck in my head all night long.  The Hubs and I took the kiddos to Hussong's on Saturday night over Memorial Day weekend. It was actually the 2nd time we'd eaten there, so we already knew it was amazing. It was crowded, but we were smart and made reservations. We were seated promptly and chips/salsa made it to our table within minutes. They serve 2 kinds of salsa and the darker of the two (chipotle, I think) is INCREDIBLE!! Honestly, I'd drink it. I might have. Don't judge. It's Vegas, baby.  But I digress...  Our server was fast, friendly and efficient. He must have been crazy busy, but he never made us feel rushed. I had the barbacoa tacos (having already sampled the Carnitas tacos last time), The Hubs had the barbacoa chimichanga, Kid #1 had chicken enchiladas with rice and beans and Kid #2 (aka Basic Baby) had cheese enchiladas. We also ordered the street corn - off the cob, please - and some bean dip. Our food came out quickly and every single thing was really good. My tacos were stuffed with juicy barbocoa and had queso fresco, cilantro and pickled onions on top. Honestly, the pickled onions sealed the deal for me. They were a perfect counter to the rich meat. Hubs said his chimichanga was out of this world, stuffed with the same rich barbacoa that was on my tacos. Both kiddos scarfed down their food, so I'm guessing they loved it as well. We need to talk about the street corn, though. Sweet corn, slathered in mayo butter, cotija and chili flakes. My only complaint is that they don't serve it 5-gallon buckets.   The Mariachi Band.  Yeah, we loved them. The Hubs was wearing a Star Wars T-shirt and as soon as they spied it, they launched into a Mariachi version of "The Imperial Death March". They played Baby Shark for my youngest kiddo, who melted from happiness. I wanted to hate them for that, but they then threw down some New Kids on the Block, so all was forgiven.   Go to Hussongs. Eat the corn. Kick it with the band. You won't forget it.

XHT_dCMlr0eyg5I1gelCBg.text: I LOVEY Hussong's Cantina!  Had lunch with friends Saturday afternoon around 3pm and the place was packed!  Lots of tv's playing College football made for a fun an exciting afternoon.  Started off ordering drinks.  They were quickly brought out by our server (can't remember his name, but he was great!), as well as a couple of baskets of chips with 2 different kinds of salsa.  The chips were warm, crispy, and delish!  I couldn't stop easing them!  The group I was with ordered various things, but I ordered the fish tacos.  The fish was hot and crispy with just the right amount of sauce and veggies.  They were so good!  My tacos also came with beans and rice.  I didn't eat much of them as I was stuffed from the 3 tacos, bunches of chips, and my Bulldog Margarita.  Oh ya, the Bulldog Margarita, I forgot to mention that it was as big as my head...lol!  The margarita was perfectly sour, and perfectly salted around the rim too.  Did I mention that you can get a margarita to go too?!  I took 2...YES PLEASE and THANK YOU! When looking for great Mexican food on the strip with a fun atmosphere, definitely check out Hussong's.  I'm already looking forward to our next Vegas trip to we can eat there again.

Very unique bar area with cool decor. Very clean and well organized. Our waiter came by to check on us several times. Food at other tables looked yummy! Will definitely come back here for dinner and leave a review for food. Recommend for drinks if your just hanging out.

TPszLLxIh2mEANa6poYhLA.text: Reviews said it was authentic food really disappointed it says authentication I'm thinking real fried spicy hot Mexican food but instead it felt more like Taco Bell food. Order chiliie reno it was not batter in egg nor cheese it was more like a stuff pepper i order a burrito $17 just for the burrito we order corn on stick beans were not friend they actually had chorizo mix in them three plates 85. Dollars and when we were paying the guy waiter luise said are you going to tip. I shock he even said that we were going to leave a cash tip at the table instead my other half was infuriated to why he even said that she went straight to management. Over all to expensive no none authentic mexican food and very rude wait waiter

kFmv5DrARucfkYeZHmstIA.text: The chimichanga my sister got was HUGE! The corn was very good! The chips and salsa was fresh and plenty.

jyZMf_2t1hUwfLDCeZZj7w.text: Amazing and absolute wonderful experience!  We sat at the bar, which is where we wanted to sit, for some drinks and snacks and the bartenders working were some of the nicest and most professional that I have seen in a long time.  All of the individuals working here were nice and professional.    We both ordered the original margaritas and they were wonderful.  The chips and salsas were good as well.  You get two types of salsas with the chips.  We also ordered some guacamole which was good as well.    For a meal I ordered the vegetable tacos and my husband ordered a mixture of shrimp, pork, and steak tacos which he said were fantastic.  They have tons of vegetarian and vegan items on the menu too!   On the night that we went there was a live mariachi band going around and taking song requests.  They were wonderful and made the experience such a great one!  I would completely recommend Hussong's Cantina to anyone looking for a quick drink, snack, or whole meal - great food, atmosphere, and waitstaff.

v-IAl-lpT48thiKBcbfH5g.text: Hussong's is an average Tex-Mex restaurant.  This one in the shops at Mandalay Place was very noisy on a Sunday late afternoon.  The football game was on so loudly it was difficult to have a conversation.  Four of us met to have dinner.  Our drinks were delivered quickly and then our order was taken.  I was the only one who uses Yelp so I used the check in offer to get a free Mexican street corn.  The corn was OK.  The kernels are a bit small this time of the year but the grilling and the cotija cheese were flavorful.  I had a bit of a smug attitude in enjoying the corn while the three others just looked on.  Yelp or lose--their choice!  We brought chips and salsas and it looked like there were three kinds of salsa.  Not so.  Two of them were fire roasted salsa and they were identical.  None of them had any zip to them.  For my main course, I got their carne asada.  It was a bit unusual the wait the thin meat was laid out along the center of the plate with some salsa verde on the meat.  The meat was cooked rare as I asked when I gave the server my order.  There was also rice, beans, and cubed potatoes.  I thought it was a bit of an odd combo for a Mexican plate. No one ordered dessert.  Hussong's was OK but there are so many places that serve more authentic and better Mexican food in Las Vegas.  This isn't the most convenient place for a local to get to.  I would wager that most of the clientele were tourists.  Well, at least I tried it.

3O2O6SCuVz1vGbvLJ4k7sQ.text: The street corn is AMAZING! If you check in on here you get the choice of a free tequila shot or street corn. We were already drinking beers, so opted for the corn. Great choice! The queso bean dip was decent, but needed more spice. Giving 4 stars because our bartender was wonderful. Really attentive and so sweet ! She heard we were in Vegas celebrating my birthday and kindly offered me a free birthday shot.

sT2TRjL5wO4G7BcmilbskA.text: This is the best place I have eaten in Vegas! The service was amazing! Bottomless Mimosas is the way to go! And if you can sit in Luis's section I would! He is so friendly and an amazing server.

h5CoozDDvZkSd53QBEX9fA.text: The food was pretty good and service was good, though when we were done it took forever to get the check. Locals discount was nice.

yGXWPDhvqsBOPxNVS9D6PQ.text: Great food at great prices especially on the strip. The pork is tender and full of flavor, quesadillas are BOMB & the Mexican corn is fantastic! They really got it right.

IbbrGs4YLM3Z5HwSIbEQsQ.text: Great food and drink!! Such a fun environment. Luis was our server and he was amazing. Highly recommend for both locals and tourists!

9hJLsj6lJv7cmdKhgEpOtA.text: The best place for dinner drinks and laughs! I can't wait to return. Rorke was our server and he was the best! He took care of our bridal party, and you know a table full of intoxicated brides maids aren't the easiest tho deal with! The mariachi was great! They took our requests and definitely made our night !

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EFZPqYwQGv5RPnoQKfNZrw.text: Outstanding happy hour drinks and food!  Marguerites are awesome!  $3 happy hour tacos and other food eats!

lGH9moqaAiUNSvWK-sMmkg.text: We immediately came back the day after and I was still highly impressed. Danielle was our server and she was absolutely phenomenal. My boyfriend still ordered the Chile relleno bc he is obsessed, and this time I ordered fajitas. He had mentioned what he loved about this place is that it is consistent. Consistency is key a well ran business and I agreed with him 100%. Impressed once again and it is easily becoming our comfortable meal in Vegas.

H0Zwpq92bUMiRyzO9fBzaQ.text: Great place! Amazing staff.! Had the chicken enchiladas for dinner at the bar last night and it was delicious. Amanda the bartender was really attentive and she made me the margarita of the month i believe was a spicy watermelon which was really good.! Definitely will be back!!

yjEjskWUfPD5xxtUmpUF5Q.text: Best place for margaritas and tacos! Our server Manny was awesome. Music And atmosphere upbeat and fun....We will be back soon!

kyI4IaUfcLZGmmrQPqS5_g.text: Came on a Saturday night around 9 pm I had the Battered shrimp tacos they were good.. the mariachi was awesome...great entertainment but there was a hair in my sons ranch dressing.. drinks were good, i had a Cadillac a bit over priced... but i would come back

nKaPQ-Lb_rqYbhXazesudg.text: Tonight was my first time tying this place and I was PLEASANTLY impressed!!! They had an entire vegan menu, my boyfriend and I each got a vegan entree and loved them both! Everyone was so sweet and professional. Our server Sarah was fantastic!!! I have zero complaints. I even got bottomless mimosas on happy hour! I will absolutely be back regularly!!

mfMMIYZoa8YJK1ZwrO1oWA.text: The salmon was awesome, server was pleasant, attentive, friendly and knowledgeable.  The atmosphere was nice and not too loud as Vegas restaurants tend to be!

4fforvqaiJQon0KYigizIQ.text: Great food, great drinks!! The band was great! Really fun atmosphere and good service. Would definitely go again!

0eKi1ulQWfXfx0zOVJ032A.text: What a fun place!  Great service, cool vibe and decor. Friendly service!  Amber was fantastic!

Ufjv2WQK_fX2fUP1RzsQfQ.text: This place was excellent!  You can judge the food by how busy it is!  We were welcomed by a three Amigos singing happy birthday and other songs for each table.  Our server, Andrew catered to all our needs and ensured we had our meals and were out in time for our show.   I had the Barbacoa Burrito. The mixture of spices, ingredients and the three condiments on top were amazing!!! - I would have to say it is one of the best I have had.   My girlfriend is a vegan and had no problems with choice, as they had an entirely vegetarian/vegan menu. She loved her burrito too!   Like I said, this place gets busy, but they still pump out their food efficiently.

JOKSpuq9GuzucMRtEP1PJg.text: Food was awesome! We had the queso w chips ,  chicken fajitas and I had the chicken burrito.. And of course a margarita! Service was on point.. Never waited for anything. Would def go back! We recommend!

U3vSFzYL6KijtxmsPtFfOA.text: This Cantina was great. The food was delicious. We ordered the Diablo Shrimp and the chicken enchiladas . Luis was our server and he treated us so well , very nice guy. Definitely coming back!

5w90d8lTPD7C64BVuQDcLw.text: I loved their chips and salsa too much and I was full by the time my dinner came.  Also the guacamole that is served with pork rinds make for a good starter.  I like that I was able to create my own taco trio combo.  The pork belly was my favorite.

c0mbpplaEi3OxvjahXLB4A.text: After searching for a good Vegan place in Vegas I came across this restaurant .I like the fact that they offer a variety of both regular menu and a viggen menu since my husband is not a vegan but we still enjoy eating together.  When we 1st got there we got seated right away I checked in and my husband was given a huge shot of tequila .  Looked over the menu and I ordered the vegan veggie enchiladas. And my husband had the chicken wet burrito.  Before our dinner came out we got chips and 3 salsas. That were delicious. A little bit later meal came even though I was really tasty and had a little bit too much salt for my taste. But the veggies were cooked deliciously  and the beans were my favorite I wasn't a big fan of the rice. My husband said his burrito was delicious and it was also a huge portion. Unfortunately I did not have Room for the vegan chocolate cake .  Our favorite part of this restaurant is the group that comes around to the tables to sing they are hilarious they make you request songs they do not charge for the songs and you just tip them at the end if you like it made our dinner that much more interesting . Definitely will be coming back here again

zw3v1MuMvdvVVXM3hD6RCA.text: Lacey our waitress was the best. Great food and wonderful atmosphere. Definitely will hit this place again on my next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bs0D-YSSajMeLj4RzETkBA.text: John and Phil are great!!! Food is fantastic! Margaritas are the best! We are locals that visit often. The mariachi band is always entertaining

YFCQEvXn4RAk6i6E8SP5Kg.text: This place has awesome Margaritas! I had one and that wasn't enough. So yeah I had to get another one. I wish I would've gotten a pitcher. Next time  On to the food. I got the free corn from yelp! Its was amazing the best I've ever had. I would've gladly paid for it! I got the breaskfast burrito. It was yummy and filling I really could only eat 1/2. It was filled with chrizio, beans (refried), cheese, and potatoes topped with 2 fried eggs. But you can get the eggs your way.   It was a bit pricey for Mexican food but it is in vegas between 2 hotels. Service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito with fried egg on top!

Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita! So dang good!

zv7YAI7YO35haR9Tsj2ymw.text: Great service from our bartender Amber the manager Chad were amazing to us the food was great and we will definitely be coming back during our trip.

lxGc3NZyKuJD2yh0o8AELg.text: The atmosphere is pretty much like a Chili's. It's quite corporate. The salsa variety that comes to the table is overly sweet and not terribly flavorful. Chips are very thick. The appetizers are actually quite good. Guacamole oddly enough comes with pork rinds. Service is quick and friendly. The place seems clean. It's just fine for fast casual.

kcOcyJaGv3e4Oy8stXtzgg.text: The vegan food is marginal, I can make better food at home. While traveling I ordered several dishes, unfortunately when it arrived some ofthe items were not vegan so I could not try them. For the price I thought the food would be fantastic, I was wrong.

tF3yCfIjN_6lNF_vGMowaw.text: The carne asada was very tough but overall it was a pretty good meal for $22 bucks.   However the carnaval drink was the size of a regular glass not like the picture and not worth the $15 bucks I ended up spending on it.   I didn't try the margarita which would have probably been better because the sign outside states original margarita. Don't think I would give this place a try again.   The chips were good but the salsa not so much
