LboSxY0APIRCjAhWr_xyJw.text: Great environment! Great music! Great staff especially Chad! And most importantly amazing food! Everything went exceptionally well including the live music ! Fantastic place and a must go !

0zQtpeLoKUTiSJkTSd5ajw.text: I had spied this restaurant when my husband and I were in town for a concert, but I didn't get to try it until 2 weeks later when I returned to Vegas for a work conference.  As luck would have it, my bff lives in town so we met up for dinner.  We had no reservation, but walked in on a Sunday night with no wait.  I had no idea that this place had vegan alternatives until I flipped the menu over.  I'm always game to try healthy alternatives to fatty favorites, so the vegan tacos were very appealing.  We ordered the street corn that was so yummy we had to order another to go.  And honestly, we could've eaten that at the table as soon as it arrived and had to order another one to try and make it to the parking lot. It's that good.  I ordered chick'n tacos with some sort of vegan style cheese that were so delicious I was licking my lips.  I washed it down with a skinny margarita.  My bff had an enchilada that she loved so much she was sure she'd have to order another one.    I couldn't believe this little place was that delicious. It may not look like much, but it is HUGE on FLAVOR. I'm not vegan, although I like the lower calorie fake meats that honestly taste pretty much like the real thing.  I will definitely return and can't wait to taste the corn and chik'n tacos again. So yummy. Get in my belly!

UJh1AzN04I3DlFkdWrwFNQ.text: Good food, good, quick service, cute atmosphere, not overpriced. We ate here before the Criss Angel show. We would go back again.

GzpnggD_m3nvOshPRp2TAg.text: The shrimp tacos were really good here. The fried fish taco, not so much. First off the chips and salsa here are pretty good.  The chips come out nice warm and salty.  The salsa has a nice spice.  The waitress was nice enough to let me order a half plate of fried shrimp tacos and fried fish taco.  I wish i got just the fried shrmp. The fish was pretty dry and flavorless, it was small and i could barely get through it.  Price isn't too bad sort of a decent cheap place to grab a meal.  One wierd thing that happened was my coworker forgot something behind and we called to check if they were in possesion of it, they put hm on hold for like 10 minutes and then just hung up on him.

w2X9eSsD33hnSAPvWz057g.text: I love Mexican food!  I love Hussongs Cantina, in Mexico. This was lame attempt at both. Food is over priced and a gringo version. Save your money and go to Taco Bell. Of course if you think of Taco Bell when you think of Mexican food you'll love this place too.

IIn6pS67U5mE0bIDF3xeJA.text: Good nachos, solid salsa, good happy hour margarita (I think they call it "the original")... Dos Equis 2 for 1s...  Attentive service, but confusing as hell on the billing. Nachos were a happy hour special, they asked what meat we wanted so we said chicken  but on the side, since one of us was vegetarian. Little did we know, that would cost us $2 extra. Not a biggie, but still. Seriously? That shouldn't be a surprise to your guest when they unexpectedly actually look at the bill you probably don't want them to look at. The Dos Equis were more than expected because apparently the "special" at the bar did not apply during happy hour. What the hell!? Still cheaper than they would've been regularly, but that's sort of weird...  They were cool about it though, and we'd go back.

SBAQk3-UEEsnlCICjTjOrw.text: Had lunch there after a morning of classes at my conference.    Hubby and I ordered fish tacos.  We liked them, but they were nothing we haven't had done just as well elsewhere.  We had discount cards, offered through my conference, for a free margarita or a free taco.  I got the free margarita, which I really enjoyed (free is good!).  Hubby decided to have the free carnitas taco.  This was a joke!  It was free, so we can't complain much, but it was so tiny.  We had a good laugh over it; I definitely got the better deal with the margarita!    Service was subpar.  We had to ask a few times for our chips and salsa, and my husband never received the drink he asked for.  Speaking of the chips and salsa, the red salsa tasted like marinara... not spicy at all.   Spendy for what you're getting, but they're taking advantage of being in a prime location -- Mandalay Place.  During our stay, we also ate at T&T, which is not far from Hussongs, in Luxor.  I'd recommend T&T over Hussongs.

mC_zZi1PU8gNzhSyLGrOdA.text: I've been wanting to try this place out for a while, and it ended up beyond worth the wait! The atmosphere is great, all kinds of random/funny things on the walls and around the bar area. They have Mariachi's sometimes, girls with shot bandelos, and handful of flat panel tvs. The staff was very friendly and made us feel like we were regulars. The chips and salsa were on par with Lindo Michocahn's, and the Original Margarita could be the best I've had in Vegas. For food, I had the Beef Tongue (Lengua) Burrito with Green Sauce, and it was extremely delicious. It is a good size portion so I had the last 1/4th the next day reheated and it was still good! The lobster tacos will prolly be my next endeavor there.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cachete Chimi Wet with Green &amp; Red sauce

V5o90rJQ99f0nOm6fab2hg.text: We recently stayed at Mandalay Bay, and after a day poolside we wanted something quick and delicious to end the day.  I could vaguely recollect my dad telling me stories of a bar he went to in the '70s and '80s in Ensenada Mexico that was the home of the margarita, and I was delighted to find out this location was the same place! The chips and salsa were amazing.  The chips were thicker than the store bought kind and you could tell they were fresh! We ordered the Queso Bean Dip as an appetizer and it was very tasty! Of course I had to get a margarita and I had the Raspberita.  Fresh raspberries and lime juice with top shelf tequila made this an amazing drink.  No store bought, processed ingredients here. The rest of my party had beer that they said was cold and tasty. For an entree, I had a pork chimichanga, and it was far and away one of the best I have ever had!  Again with the fresh ingredients, and do not even get me started on the amazing guac!  I can  not recall what the other three had, but everyone enjoyed and there was no food left on any plate! I would go back to Mandalay Bay just to eat at this restaurant.  This is what Vegas dining is all about.  On this trip we at a couple celebrity chef restaurant (Gordon Ramsey and Bobby Flay), and this meal blew the others out of the park!

dCCFZYjA8dl6VFfrk8-dWQ.text: Took advantage of a Travelzoo coupon, thinking it was a good value and hoping to find a new Mexican restaurant hangout now that chef Richard Sandoval's uber yummy Isla restaurant at Treasure Island has closed. Was disappointed the moment I saw the restaurant as it lacked any real ambiance...more like a cookie cutter Mexican sports bar. Still, wanted to give it a chance.  While the original margaritas were decent, the only thing that really stood out was the grilled Mexican corn. The sopes appetizer was hit and miss...the two pulled chicken ones were good but the two carnitas ones were dry and had that reheated fatty carnitas flavor. Ditto on the carnitas platter entree. Baja fish tacos were just OK, nothing like the yummy ones in Baja. Salmon with chipotle sauce was prob the most impressive. But even their Spanish rice was dry and refried beans were spicy but not flavorful.  But here's the kicker, Travelzoo couponers: beware of the 18 percent tip that the management tags on to the bill. While the voucher says the meal doesn't include tip, it doesnt mandate a certain percentage to tip, leaving it up to the customer. When we inquired about this to the manager, he said that we've always added that to the checks. He then went on to say we are the first to complain about it, as if to imply we are crazy for even questioning it. We insisted on him taking it off, which he finally did albeit with an attitude. We left 15 percent, which is what the server deserved.  Again: watch out for the bogus 18 percent tip add-on. And, furthermore, the entire itemized check as our server ended up overcharging us for our meal despite the voucher...tacked on an extra drink! Fortunately, we know to look for that stuff.

rqiqntIVjAOWgCbUXb0MZg.text: One of our favorite Mexican places on the Strip!  The funny thing is that you would think it's a Chinese restaurant based on the name.  We asked our server the story behind the name and she gladly shared it with us.    Cool vibe, friendly staff, chill atmosphere.  Try the Sopas, Tortilla Soup (although it's better at Border Grill), Street Tacos, and OH YEAH, the Fried Ice Cream!!  We are regulars here!!

ATA9dg1DFXHYbz1TBybdzA.text: Horrible! Terrible service and bad food. My burrito was cold and nasty. Waiter only came by once the entire meal to check on us.

XmNr2PMlG5U6RF-BA-66gA.text: Been here many times and it's always great, but not this past visit (today, 20 minutes ago).  We sat down at the bar and we're promptly told we couldn't sit there because the bartender needed time to 'catch up'.  WTF does that mean?  The manager was there watching the baryender, not helping of course, so we asked her again and she said no seating there yet. That is the strangest thing I've seen at A BAR - no sitting at the bar when there are seats available. The manager on duty should be retrained, at the least, or reassigned to be a bartender so she learns how to help when needed.

77OzNeQ6gP9NQH2Qq7r3jw.text: I'Il have to take a pass on this place with one caveat. If you are going for drinks and tortilla chips this place is just fine. For dinner ... not so much. We were served raw chicken. Just nasty.

dkI5mHpMX6utKrmz1WU0Rg.text: Decent food. Great service.  Something a little different but still good. Went for lunch and the husband loved the tacos. Try the cheese dip that is a little extra with the chips and you will be plesently surprised. So why only 3 stars? The other food was "meh" but at the same time the service was great.

DmQeMbZ--9JQFzCM9ETzww.text: This place was mediocre..no complaints really but nothing really wowed me to come back..

dIBUDDeVwtPRYcHN-JJtfw.text: After walking and rushing from one end of the strip all the way to Mandalay Bay just so we can get our Lion King tickets before the box office close, we were SO GLAD to have found this place. And a good thing we did because we got to try the Bone Marrow and it was SUPERB!   It sounded weird at first but apparently the Bone Marrow were these large bone marrows served with sides of chimichurri salsa, onion-cilantro mix and corn tortillas. It was on the fatty side, but it was delicious and a cool experience. I ordered the Quesadilla while my friend ordered the tortas. We both thought the quessadilla and tortas were just OK while the bone marrow was something to rave about. I like the chips and salsa that we got when we sat down- spicy!

mh5I-Cic_AGqxAb4fSfgGg.text: Great vegan/vegetarian selection! Great to be able to have options.  Also possibly the best chips and salsa I've ever had.

PLOlu4DVQqDsYz4gyUq8NA.text: Yummy Margartia, good service, but the food wasn't anything special.  We came in for a quick, light lunch during our stay at Mandalay Bay.    Our server came by right away and took our drink order.  I ordered a Pepino Margarita and he asked if I could handle the heat and I said yes.  It was really good and spicy, but not necessarily hot to me.  We ordered tres tacos, which our server upgraded to 4 (2 steak and 2 chicken) and a chicken quesadilla to share.  Our server mentioned these were small plates, but we didn't want to eat much.  Overall, the food was on the bland side I thought.

NCRTTPMyqsOKknofIUwWCw.text: I first started going to the original Hussong's in Ensenada in '73.  I was amused to see that they had opened a place at Mandalay, but my expectations were low, given Las Vegas's tendency to do recreations that are skin-deep at best.  Nonetheless, not having been to the real thing in a few years due to border violence, my wife and I decided to check it out.  As far as the decor and look of the place, they did about as good a job as can be expected.  It has a lot of the touches of the original...albeit with a lack of the grit and wear of years.  The service was pretty good...a young lady named Yolanda was attentive, and friendly, as was the hostess who seated us.  In fact, Yolanda recommended an excellent tequila (although it would be much better if they had a printed list from which to choose).  The food was another story.  (I've eaten in restaurants all over Mexico from resorts to baja joints to Mexico City).The salsas were pretty good, but everything else, the beans, rice, lobster tacos, and carne asada were  bland, and the presentation was weak.  Speaking of presentatioin, the "toreados" (jalapenos stuffed with cheese) were sitting on a plate with some mysteriouis brown liquid swishing around the bottom...not very appetizing for an appetizer.  also, the jalapenos should have been deveined and seeded better...as a result they were inedibly hot.  Based on our experience, it was a typical case of another Las Vegas restaurant that knows they don't have to rely on repeat business, because there's a new load of customers coming into town every day. Overall a big disappointment, but I have to give credit to the designers who did a fairly credible job of recreating the look of Hussong's, and the wait staff who were friendlier than a lot of LV restaurant staff.  I seriously doubt we'll go back unless I hear that there have been dramatic changes in the food.

J0HUdbWPwxOTQ-vm_QqF5w.text: Great food, wonderful service.  Didn't have to wait for our meal even though the place was very busy.  If you've ever been to the original Hussong's you'll quickly notice the decor is similar (a lot cleaner of course).  Did I mention the the food was great!

IsGbddsQVBbLWGVFXlyYzA.text: Wow...the Steak Burrito was to die for!  I got it mojado style with both the red and green sauce and I literally cleaned my plate.  Soooo delicious! A little pricey, $15 for a burrito, but what do you expect for a restaurant in a Las Vegas casino.  By looking at their menu, seems like they have something for everyone, they even had bone marrow as a "meat" option for your burrito or tacos.   Two thumbs up!

cQUCDljyfYpMcEaTOp2u5Q.text: 2nd visit: Tried the lobster tacos.  Very cheesy. Hard to detect the lobster, although I did have a few large chunks.  The chips were warm, the guacamole tasty, margarita and service good.

_S_B4EM1xdzHBuDFJGrEHg.text: Wow - I am not a big fan of Mexican food, so the fact that I'm giving Hussong's five stars says a lot!  Great service, Great food, and you even get some live entertainment.    Chips and salsa were so fresh and delicious!  I had fish tacos with Grilled Tilapia that were seriously fantastic!  So good that I can't wait to have this again!  Yum!  Hubby had the Pork Belly tacos - also delicious!  Drinks are strong and well made.  Very pleasantly surprised - can't wait to return to Hussong's!

auQJtG2j-7Dv7QWWCKofhw.text: We have been going to Hussong's for at least 9 years & always make it a point to go back every visit to Las Vegas! We had the classic guacamole which was served w/ pork rinds (keto friendly version), and the shrimp, steak and carnitas fajitas. The steak was perfectly cooked. We especially love the roasted corn and potatoes in this dish. A pitcher of skinny margaritas made for a great time. 5 out of 5 stars all day long! See you next time!

0z8Zp5-8bVd1mFDGH_CKzw.text: Amber is such a joyful fun happy person....very enjoyable time here....so glad we found it....Amber made us feel so welcome...

aiUjBUOkAGXD8fGWOenBpA.text: OMG Best Vegan Mexican food I've ever had. The "chicken" and "beef" look and taste like the real deal. Even the texture is right. Also the "cheese" they use tastes good and melts. I've had their burrito and quesadillas and both were awesome. Will definitely be coming back here, especially for happy hour with the quesadillas.

J1hhFS8-BkvZkoTQI2Ve7g.text: FRIKIN BOMB!!!!!! Not your ordinary Mexican food. Super duper bomb! Next time In Vegas def going back!

h6LZ-LVRBHPvF68_nPfFvQ.text: Great atmosphere. Great sangria's. The salsa and chips were very good. I was not wow'ed by the tacos or huarache. John was a great bartender/ server and offered great conversation! They have live music and a laid back vibe!

aFFnRlAwb9x4uOyVG1AkwQ.text: 5 star food, drinks, and service tucked between the Luxor and Mandalay Bay.   Walking back to the Luxor after a long day of trade show realness I walked past Hussongs and checked out the menu. After a quick back to my room to change and read a few reviews I went back. The wait was minimal, the service was great even though they were busy. The swirl margaritas were excellent. Not too strong but refreshing and just good.  Had a queso dip with the chips and different salsas and also a taquitos appetizer I could have eaten several more. I had the steak chimichanga smothered with the tri sauce recommended by the waiter. It was huge and freaking delicious. My friend had three tacos convo platter. Again this was some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. A rare 5 star from me

yiDOHcFeiGLTobBA8ANzpw.text: We came here for some drinks to start our night, Phil our bartender was awesome!  There was a mariachi band that was so good!  I'm sad this place does not have better reviews because it is the best place in Vegas hands down for a margarita!  I hope you get Phil because he is the best!

W6kVIovBBONMW2fsiMyBbw.text: This is definitely a new favorite spot and I am a local. Saul was a great server, bottomless mimosa and happy hour margaritas worth every cent. Service was more yhan exceptional  and the food was delicious. Not all, but many recipies were closer to authentic than other mexican cuisine restaurants.

x5sLjUp2BndWVj1Wy9luyQ.text: My brothers and I  came here for some refreshments and a lite snack. We ordered their pork belly tacos and the shrimp appetizer.  The tacos were delicious!!!!  However, the shrimp......well, they were a lot smaller than what was shown on the menu. It looked like they cut the shrimp into pieces and then sprinkled them on top of a bed of lettuce. The chef must have been in a frugal mood that day. Lol!!! But the service was great!!!!! Georgiana, our waitress and Amanda, our bartender, were both outstanding!!!!! Service with a smile, attentive, and courteous!!!!    The pork belly tacos, the drinks, and most of all, the wonderful pretty ladies who served us, is what made me give this a 5 star!!!!  I will definitely come back here again, and I highly recommend this place!!!!

nt0Y8YX56KilxwCKOlcC-w.text: Excellent all the way around! Service was fabulous and all staff were friendly and helpful! Food was amazing, and the drinks were as well! We got the mango habanero guac, margarita flight, and chills relleno. All of it was superb. They also gave out free tequila shots at 9:30 and had a fun mariachi band playing there - very talented and fun group!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V9jbYXWbWBzDXywg04jnEw.text: They had a Hussongs in Reno Nevada and it had a reputation for being, well, bad. Im happy to report on what I found in Vegas.  I found a little history on margaritas here at Hussongs, but at $25 a throw, i decided to skip the maggie. They had a decent selection of them though. I ordered the 3 tacos, and I was able to mix and match them. I ordered 2 barbacoa, and 1 pork belly. WOW. Dont get me wrong, the barbacoa was good but the pork belly was freaking delicious! Sweet and savory, salty and fatty, it was everything a fat man could want, and more. The waitress informed me that it was her favorite, and when she comes into work its the first thing she eats and always looks forward to them! The refried beans were ok, as was the rice. When you order you get chips and 2 types of salsa, the chips were nicely warm and the salsa's were very mild. I ordered a habanero salsa (it was free) to go with my tacos. OK, i only recommend the habanero salsa to True fire eaters. I couldnt put but the smallest teardrop amounts on my tacos and i love hot food.   The staff! Everyone was awesome, the manager even came over and chatted us up about the chips. The server looked like Laura San Giacomo, but only like 20 years younger and 10 times cuter. She was a real pleasure to have met. If only I was able to turn back time 20 years, so she could properly turn me down.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly and 2 barbacoa!

LsRsTUAULD1YHxqCFcoLNA.text: We just came in to sit at the bar to have some original margaritas during happy hour.  My friend says the margaritas here are the best in Vegas and he wanted a few before leaving again for at least 7 months.    He's right.  They make a mean margarita here.  And it's much larger than I thought it would be so that made me happy.  I'm used to drinking skinny margaritas so they were a bit sweet to me but very very tasty.  I'm kind of looking forward to coming back to this place to have another and try some of the food.

nA-unBuyd_8ubX4Gz5g0QA.text: Fun and relatively inexpensive at the Shoppes at Mandalay Place for pretty authentic Mexican food. The place is popular especially during the daily Happy Hour ... Beer is $4, Tacos are $3, Tostada is $5, fresh chips and two salsas are free and replenished.  Our server "Luis" was great!  I'd recommend Hussongs especially if you want a reasonably-priced and fast-serving sit-down dinner before catching a show at the Luxor (Blue Man) or Mandalay Bay (Michael Jackson One).

OcPDDuLfr_SxyaX5wye3wg.text: Was lucky enough to score reservations here during Cinco De Mayo. The atmosphere was very lively despite the close quarters. As depicted in the photo a 10% discount was offered if you ordered in "Macho Man" Randy Savage voice! My party found this both fun and entertaining throughout the evening.   Service was top notch but let's talk about why we are really here, the food. The enchilada trio was especially good. The shrimp/red sauce combo was spot on. A friend had a chicken chimichanga and was impressed with it as well.   Complimentary chips with two types of salsa get your meal started.   Would dine here again for a relaxed casual Mexican meal with really great food.

4wP0S8Eazg7wbjBxHRfrdQ.text: This place never disappoints. They are quick and friendly with service, the food is really good, and they have a good selection of tequilas. It's nice to not have to wait ridiculously long to be seated! They also have guys that walk around the bar and play your favorite songs on guitar and sing for tips. They also have vegan options! I make it a point to come here whenever I'm in Vegas. Do t forget to redeem your yelp offer! I redeemed a free shot of tequila the last time I came here! It's not top shelf but... it's free and it gets the job done!

Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Happy Hour in Vegas

Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love this place it&#39;s my favorite happy hour in Vegas and Regina is my favorite waitress!!!!  The food is delicious they have happy hour

SSc7qobT4OS4QoN7660mOw.text: Awesome vegan food! I got the chile relleno plate with rice and beans, chips & salsa, and a margarita with an extra tequila shot (for free if you check in on Yelp). My friend loved her corn on the cob, which can also be made vegan and the happy hour taco. Great happy hour! Can't wait to go back!

ldtx648I8yf4y725c3kqcQ.text: Hussong's Las Vegas has the BEST grilled corn on the cob, they will even cut it off of the cob for you.  Phil the bartender is the best and will take great care of you.  He is very outgoing and provides excellent service.   I will come back every time I come to Vegas which is monthly.

LQLZGjeMACFYTINFFA-Rvg.text: Best Margaritas ever made!!!! 3 shots of alcohol per glass. They claim to invent it and they make them with agave and lime only.   So now yelp check-in: every-time you check in, yes, every time you check in you get a choice of free a tequila shot or a big corn... their 1 shot = 2.5 Canadian shots. The tequila they serve is Don Julio Reposado, which is good one.  They something called all day beer happy hour for 15.99$.   Okay lets get over with booze and talk about food.. Vegans- they have a whole vegan menu and whatever I had was super-some!!! Portions are huge!!!   Happy hour menu- 3$ taco! Time to try all of them.   I tried vegan fish and vegan chicken - both equally good. Hubby had normal fish and chicken and he loved both them.  Next visit I tried veggie enchiladas- good!!! For sauce they have a choice of 3 different of a mix of all 3. I tried the dish with all the 3. I liked the green one the most. Enchiladas were 3 filled with grilled onions and jalapenos and potatoes. Served with refried beans and rice. Beans super good!!!  The grilled corn was soooo good. Tender and with perfect Mexican cheese and seasoning.  The service is great , we were served by Sandra and David, both made us feel special.  Oh did I meantime about the complementary nachos and salsa. The portions was too generous and we asked for refills and we got them!!!  Overall a great experience!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican charred Grilled Corn
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie enchiladas
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tacos!! 3$ per @ happy hour 3:00-6:00 PM

B8bgsWWaRvxX3VU0T2aEvg.text: This restaurant was amazing. It was located in the shops connecting Luxor and Mandalay Bay.  They serve pretty good food and the best margaritas we ever had. Their original margaritas were probably the strongest cocktail I have had so far. They use pint-sized glasses for serving them. Half of the glass is filled with tequila and agave syrup before adding anything else. It wasn't your regular margarita where the bartenders fill up 3/4th of the glass with ice. The service was very personable. The menu was varied and everything we tried ranged from very good to frigging fantastic.   The have happy hour from 3-6 pm everyday where tacos (except seafood) are 3$ each, house margaritas for 6$ each. To top it off, they offer a tequila shot or Mexican street corn free on each yelp checkin (not just the first one).  If only the tooth fairies existed I would glad give my front teeth to have them open a restaurant in GTA, and you would know where to find me most weekends. :)

FeKyiJojzyAhd6hv3yQlfg.text: So... If the service was 5 stars, and my food was 3.5 stars, I think a 4 star review is fair. My margarita was definitely 5 star worthy. But my fiancee wasn't too fond of her food. I'll get to that later... My fiancee and I got there about an hour before Hussongs closed. If you check into Yelp up there, you can get a free piece of grilled corn or a shot of tequila. Of course I took the free shot!!! I loved the raspberry margarita too!! It had some kick to it, the margarita wasn't a punk lol Gerardo, our server, made sure to not leave us hanging. My water was never empty. My chips & salsa stayed full. By the way, I love their pico!! Nice and mild with a sweet touch to my pallet. I was happy with my barbacoa enchiladas. Just a tip, mix the red sauce with the queso sauce. My chicken enchiladas with green and queso sauce was bomb.com too! However my fiancee wasn't too happy with her fish OR carne tacos. She complained about the one shell VS two shells. Her shells ripped because they weren't double shelled. And she didnt like the garnish on her tacos, however she liked the fish in the taco. I liked the tacos personally, but she feels the food is overpriced for the taste. But, this is my review. The hell with her picky food having opinions! As I'm writing this review eating breakfast, she just complained about her order not being correct. Even though she got exactly what she ordered from the server. Hussongs is all good in my book. Killer margaritas, with the 1st shot on them. Fun atmosphere. Great service. Good food. How can you go wrong?!?! By not doubling down on the taco shells lol

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finish a margarita and shot, get a refill!
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour for all Golden Knights games! Plus 1st shot free just for checking in on Yelp!
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fiancee had fish and carne tacos. We had an awesome time at Hussong&#39;s!

8y5A6rhk3jkor4cJs3vuPQ.text: Let me start by saying , this place has the best margaritas I've ever had. They don't use a mix they use fresh fruit to blend them, so you really taste the difference. I went Sunday night with three other people and we all ordered different things. The table went completely silent once the food came out. So needless to say everyone loved it! When we arrived I checked in on yelp and received a coupon for a free shot of tequila or piece of Mexican Street corn. My wonderful waitress told me that their corn was the bomb , so I chose it and was blown away by how good it was. So if your ever in Vegas and want Mexican food. I highly recommended this place!

l_TDOI7vwUNtjegz8FZ-qQ.text: Happy hour here is great! I think tacos become $3 each and you get free corn when you check in on yelp. They also had bogo free margaritas since it was margarita day.   I took off a star because I didn't like their tortilla. It was soggy probably from the meats and sauce. And the tortilla didn't have any taste.

MbXC08hl7XP8irH9VD0KDQ.text: Vegan menu   Fresh chips and great salsa    Perfect guacamole   Fantastic shrimp ceviche  Solid margaritas   Free shots at 9:30   Pricy but what you'd expect in a casino. Solid choice for Mexican in Las Vegas.

qVXyxpKovjajGeXM6keyLA.text: This review is for the location inside Mandalay Bay. I would have given a higher score, but the service wasn't good.  We went to Hussong's on May 25 before watching the New Kids on the Block concert. We had a 6 pm reservation. We were 15 minutes but was taken to our table right away. It wasn't busy yet when we got there. It took about a good ten minutes before we could flag down anybody to our table. A guy in a blue collared shirt came over, took our drink orders and walked away. A female server finally showed up...but went to the table next to us, who was seated a good 10 minutes AFTER  we did. She took their order and walked away. And didn't acknowledge us. Another 10 minutes passed and she FINALLY showed up. No apologies whatsoever. The only comment she said was if we were FINALLY ready to order. Uh, we were ready twenty minutes ago. To the kitchen's credit, our food came out fast and they were really good. We had guacamole, and some of the street tacos.  Too bad we couldn't take the leftovers home with us.  When it was time to pay, we had to flag another server. I think our server disappeared. He brought the bill to us.  I made another reservation for July. Hopefully the service will be better. The food is really good that is why I rebooked. I also made a reservation in two weeks at the Boca Park location.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner before NKOTB

-GcadkG0j38AMXIHx5V5Bw.text: Really fun atmosphere, this was my 2nd time - we went here before a show. It was packed but we got right in and very much enjoyed the great chips (were just wanting a refill but didn't ever get one) The guacamole was yum yummy and original margaritas was very good !! Tacos were good too, but would try something different next time.  Would've given this a 5 star if we had had a different server...not overly attentive or friendly...I know they were busy but the other server next to us was on it!! Friendly and seemed to give her tables great service with a smile!

gtvU7zzuWQvDmGJNg-2rOA.text: This is a conflicted restaurant!   First the name "Hussong's" starts off sounding like a Chinese restaurant....but then it's a Cantina.  Next the location is in a shopping mall. It's hard to know what to expect....  Despite both of these slightly misleading clues...this is GREAT Mexican Restaurant!!!   I found it on YELP, and even our Uber driver, who has driven for years in Vegas... said he never heard of it  This is a great find! It was one of the best meals we had in Vegas, and by far the most fun!  There is a YELP coupon for a free tequila shot or roasted corn.   We all had different entrees, and they were all excellent!  The Mariachi band was phenomenal! They could play anything and so engaging.  Go to the mall, Yes it's Mexican! Have a super time and tasty meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free shot of tequila!
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zIXdINZn4GXjemXnqhFfOw.text: I am a big fan of Hussong's - and for one reason: the nachos. The nachos here are some of the best I have ever had. There are several options to choose from, and every time they do them just right. Great chips, great toppings, and just the right amount of toppings. And considering the size of the portion (and the quality of the toppings), the price isn't all that bad. Other menu items are ok, but it is the nachos that keep me coming back.  Now, praise of the nachos aside, I don't care for their margaritas, the service can be spotty, and it can be too loud and obnoxious for me at peak times. But if you come in before the dinner rush, sit at the bar, and order the nachos, it can be just right.

RV1PyfdM-11Eg0ZfYJ0BWg.text: An authentic Mexican Restaurant created from a German Guy is direct translation of Hussong's.  Love mariachi three piece band. Love the Sombreros on the Deers on the wall. Love that you have to leave the restaurant for the bathroom.  Its just like back to the future.  Next time I would like to request De Colores, por favor.   Perfect for large table parties but good for tables of two, too.  Just make sure you get lemon or limes in the water. Just sayin...

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Posole

h_LLHRWMc_8ivWOeKr06Jw.text: The service was excellent. Jessi was very friendly and attentive. She made us feel like family. The margarita was great and the food was good.  The house guacamole was excellent.  I definitely recommend this restaurant and I suggest you ask for Jessi's section!

3QFjgw12oFTbw2eCO_aQ2w.text: The food was delicious! If you're a micro-greens garnish kind of foodie then you'll enjoy this place!

X5vEPD-lXkFRDBs6i77puA.text: I didn't know what I wanted and saw that this place had good reviews...I sat at the bar and both bartenders greeted me separately which I gotta give points for. Usually when one greets, sometimes the others will consider the hospitality has been fulfilled.  The food was flavored pretty good also. I'll be back and recommend.

vrsxIrm91MrF6DBpv4AdsA.text: I have been staying at Mandalay Bay for many years and I love great customer service and food. This is a shout out to great food and customer service. Hussong's manager Chad hooked me and my family with amazing customer service and made us feel that we want to keep coming back every time we visit Vegas. Hussong's  service and caring is rare nowadays and it should be rewarded. Thank you Chad for your dedication to making your customers feel special even when your customer base is usually one and done. Please visit this business when you are from out of town and ask for chad to get  that great old school service.

JkNaXjjCHFkRs4fpG6U-nQ.text: Delicious margaritas...totally worth $45 for a pitcher. Had the Kung pow shrimp tacos which were just so-so...they were lukewarm upon receiving. It also took a bit longer to receive our food. (we had a party of 5) However, the larger party that was seated after us promptly received theirs...I understand stuff happens in the kitchen though and honestly the margarita saved the day. Will be back to give it another try.

BKWFwtdqXQg3zGQqAkRYdQ.text: Wow, what an awful experience. Maybe it was an off night? Our evening didn't go nearly as well as some of these other reviews.  What started off as a 30- to 40-minute wait turned into an hour, followed by a 45-minute wait for our food after ordering. Service: 0/5.  Our food came, and it was extremely hit and miss. Guacamole, quesadilla, and burger and fries (oddly), all great. Definitely would recommend those. However, the tacos (awful), Mexican and cheesy rices (badly undercooked), beans (off flavors), carne asada (rubbery), and salad (criminally under-lettuced) all were some of the worst Mexican food our party has ever had.  We did manage to get free swag (sunglasses and shirts) from some restaurant sponsors, but that did very little to make up for the $150 we spent on a pretty awful experience. YMMV

leEmLPY7zsTk4ZcTS7N4-Q.text: Came for the vegan menu. Total bust. Got the tostada salad and the quesadilla. Not exaggerating here- IT WAS GROSS. The lettuce was wilted and brown and soaked in dressig. The quesadilla was supposed to have a bunch of fajita veggies including roasted corn and it was just filled with undercooked onions.  The waitress was constantly trying to up-sell us.  The one star is for the chips, which were delicious.  Other than that, it was a bad and overpriced experience.

7_EJ2Y_yxPQ0BwytzZ9JEw.text: Tommy and Brandie are awesome behind the bar, the mariachis make for an awesome authentic atmosphere!! The house margarita rocks! Ask for locals discount!!!

9O_m3pNPhoOEfR7SxY3USQ.text: They serve breakfast all day!!! We have been coming here for about 7 years as a must do while in Vegas. Always great Mexican food and margaritas at a reasonable price with good service. I love the fish tacos. You get many different types of salsa to try and the chips are amazing!

cVuh_zWhw0_jZkpBNxM-uw.text: Located in Mandalay Place, inside of Mandalay Bay resort hotel casino on the famous Las Vegas Strip. I love this place, I will start by saying the owners are incredibly nice. The food is fantastic, and they have a Mariachi band that plays Neil Diamond! That's not enough for you? Ok then, they have one of the best happy hours on the strip, a killer selection of tequilas and did I mention fantastic food? I am looking forward to my next visit, there is so much more on the menu I want/need to try. If you find yourself on the south side of the strip stop in, you wont be sorry. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

H4BnDVflyIb2P60shryV8Q.text: Really good food and a pitcher of Margarita to wash it all down.  Previously had a burrito and it was very good.  Today will be a Hussongs Chili Relleno.  Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pitcher of Margarita (it is Friday!), chips, and a Tomatillo salsa that is the bomb!

bN5kpKq-SwcAsYvdHot7MA.text: LOVED THE MARIACHI! So warm, welcoming and talented. Our server was great and the vegan menu drew us to this place. The location wasn't well placed however it was good nonetheless. The salsa options (3 options) were good. The vegan menu was hard to choose from. We got the "steak salad" and "chicken enchiladas" the salad was basic but the steak was great. The enchiladas came with rice and beans which were good but the chicken in the enchiladas were dry and sauce-less unfortunately. I'd love the steak enchiladas a try maybe?! Perhaps may be the best of both worlds. Will come back just bc of the vegan options to try it out once more

3TJD5ep9s3dz7u9izeP1bQ.text: The nachos are large, but they're not much to write home about. If I'm leaving food on a plate, then it wasn't worth eating, and we didn't finish. There was a mix up with our order, and it took a little long to get settled with the check, etc. Service was friendly, and it was a pretty good value for being off a casino.

s-vj5gam66CA2egJV8XGLw.text: Ok noobs.   Whoever gave this place a 5 star ratings you guys were probably drunk. Friend and I went there, got seated right away but we waited 20 minutes until the server acknowledged us. We hella devoured that chips and salsa and even memorized the menu in 20 minutes.  Got the nachos and steak tacos. Mehhhhh I'd rather go someplace for that! So not worth the prices of $14 for nachos and $15 for tacos. I had the original margarita, yest that was delicious, but for a $12 drink? Eh.   On their menu, it says "If you don't like our service, tell us first not Yelp." something like that...well, TOO LATE! For my bottom line here, bad service, over priced food, and good margarita. TWO STARS!

c7tbWXRAlbNOgbpCJA7iUw.text: Upon our arrival to Las Vegas, we were hungry and in the mood for some Mexican food.  I heard Hussong's had vegan options so we headed there.  The restaurant is located in the Mandalay Bay Shoppes.  I was happy to be seated right away and even happier that they had a separate vegan menu.  I scanned the vegan menu and noticed they use Gardein Chick'n and Daiya cheese. I'll have mock meat occasionally but not too often so I opted for the Baja style veggie tacos - double stacked corn tortillas, served with guacamole, breaded zucchini, tomatillo-avocado salsa, and cabbage mix. My boyfriend ordered the Chick'n burrito which had Gardein Chick'n strips, Pico de Gallo, Daiya shreds, vegan sour cream, rice, and pinto beans served on a mix of lettuce and tomatillo-avocado sauce.  We thought the food was ok and was pricey for Americanized Mexican food.  But I get it that it's a tourist spot so a lot of the food is overpriced. I give it 3 stars for food, but since the service was great and they have a separate vegan menu I'm giving them another star.  Our waiter brought our food out quickly and always made sure we had everything we needed.    If I'm ever near Mandalay Bay, I'm glad I can come here for vegan options or I may try their sister restaurant next door Slice of Vegas which also has a vegan menu. Being vegan in Vegas seems pretty easy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja style veggie tacos
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan chick&#39;n burrito

8WX3CJZ-4FI2-P4wpK77rg.text: They have the best Margaritas in town.  Brandie is the best! She is a great bartender! Great service and awesome happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brandie at Hussong&#39;s

6sSG7aaCA77cD9L1Z76ujA.text: I'm not sure why this was a recommended vegetarian spot. I tried the vegetable taco combo: potato, mushroom, and avocado. I would order the avocado again; it tasted the least like fried fish. The blackberry & ginger margarita was 99% tequila, which might be a plus under certain circumstances.

4PQ-WSUAVPVwP8iHbQJAtA.text: Great, fun atmosphere and food! Having a blast with friends. The street corn is really good...perfect snack or way to start a meal. I'll be coming back for that!

HSfeGUolUO1ciFR4WyrKbw.text: Best authentic Mexican food and margaritas. The service was the best.  Good prices, too!

MSG8RvF2aAZBkx-fGseMig.text: I came for my friends birthday, and I have to say that this place is awesome. The mariachi was so good they were taking all kinds of requests. The meals are a decent price but you should know that this is a restaurant and it wil have standard restaurant prices. The kicker for me were their margaritas, they make it nice and strong but still tastes so good you lose track of how many drinks you've had. Overall the experience was great and I ordered their chicken which had a great marinade.

YgtgphuNYE285dBi64Bv4Q.text: Good restaurant - must try the grilled corn.  The taco's are good, but service is iffy.  Don't eat here if you are in a hurry.

s1a8jJ_ggZDawqA5k_r2vw.text: Great staff and food. Margarita is superb.

gxzWWU__J4pito9dmihpxw.text: Any person that loves drinking margaritas MUST experience this place! *Tip - order the original first, experiment afterward (if your totally addicted to the original) The food is good not exceptional the margaritas are all world, the service was friendly and attentive.

m7AElTMR-xXHeMeXsRQIDw.text: This Place is the Biggest Bull Bleep I been to in Vegas.  The promo write ups talk about how this is the inventors of the margarita, Playboy, Urban Daddy and Seven.  The original margarita was made with Tequila, limes and Damiana.  Not only did they tell us that they didn't have Damiana but that it wasn't available in the state.  Funny I picked up a bottle at Lee's the next day.  Stay away from this place.  $10.- small house margaritas.

A44EtjerRzuZy8QTarurEg.text: Such a great place to go eat, drink and just simply relax and have a good time.  Everytime I am in Vegas, I make a point to get over there for lunch and/or dinner whether I am staying at Mandalay Bay/The Hotel/Luxor, or not.   The atmosphere is great fun...especially with the Mariachi Band.  They can play almost anything you request.  The Margaritas are awesome too!    When you go, you must try the Abondigas Soup and the Fried Shrimp and Avocado Salad....soooooo, good!!

ucJVWBjEhttH-tRbMtP1Fg.text: What a wonderful night!  We were a group of people who hardly knew each other, all brought together for a mutual friend's wedding in Vegas.  It did not matter that we were mostly strangers when the mariachi band started singing with us and entertaining our group.  They were funny and very witty - and good singers as well.  The food was excellent.  Not one person in our group was unhappy.  I was not expecting the food or the ambiance to be so good/fun and will come back every time I am in Vegas.

aZui74S9NIeOTgWm7TEa2Q.text: Not the greatest Mexican food.   Definitely overpriced for the quality of food served.    I ordered the "enchiladas" and I didn't think they were very good.  They seemed to be a bit tough when I tried to cut in half.  I didn't really think you could screw up rice and beans...you can actually screw up rice and beans.    I'm sure you can find cheaper and inexpensive Mexican food off of the strip.

gDBj_qQSu4A64IONQH6koA.text: I had gone to Hussong's a few months back and it made my Vegas experience even better. The environment is awesome, very casual and has a great vibe. I ate the nachos and the fish tacos which were unreal, they say you wont pull a chip out without something on it which was exactly what happened. I was also with a group of my buddies and we ordered the party load of margaritas which was a perfect addition to a great time. I would recommend Hussong's to anyone in Vegas that is trying to have a great time and is trying to eat some bomb food.

k823EmiVGlnqdYNfaA2QbQ.text: Had a great lunch here recently.  After the awful Cabo Wabo margs, we had to try again here.  Really good drinks - and at a reasonable price.  We went with their fresh lime juice version - nummy stuff.  Good balance of tart and sweet, and tequila flavor.  Had the grilled jalapeno appetizer - different, but liked it.  The worchestershire was a strange but tasty addition.  We both had tacos - carnitas was my favorite, followed by the beef cheek my husband ordered, then the steak.  Nothing bad in the selections.  And if you're craving your yearly portion of bone marrow tacos, yes, they have it.

GF4ZQS6kmw6SO1AcRnXqzQ.text: Food is great, but the service is terrible. Waiter tried to upsell us during happy hour and was very cool to us as we weren't drinking as much as the couple across from us. Save yourself a trip and go  to tacos and tequila instead.

CGhpsBUuScnlth7c3q4K2w.text: I had the best experience at Hussongs! I was in Vegas for Labor Day weekend with 3 of my friends and we headed to Hussong's before we went out on the town. We got a table almost immediately and had a great, chill server. The ambiance is great because everyone is just there to have a great time with great food, drinks, and service. We got nachos and tacos and OMG sooo good! Can't forget to mention the endless chips and salsa which come with two different and delicious salsas. The margaritas were delicious too, and everything is reasonably priced, especially for Vegas. Go to Hussongs if you want delish Mexican with a friendly and fun environment!

oB0rtiGeqDLDBCycOaggfA.text: I wish there was one on the East Coast! Every time I am in Vegas I have to stop in for the margaritas and tacos. They are both as authentic as it gets! The ambiance is great too... it reminds me of a Mexican saloon. The complimentary chips and salsas (you get a couple) are delicious. I have tried most of the appetizers, all of the salads, as well as the chicken and lobster tacos. So far - the nachos, fried avocado salad and lobster tacos are at the top of my list. If you are adventurous, I've heard the bone marrow dish is out of this world. The bartenders are great and make every margarita by hand to order... I mean squeezing the limes and all! It is certainly a must try next time you're in Sin City!

HSExfuFRSqHAjgqJpCutrQ.text: Amazing! Seriously Good! Going back tomorrow for more!  We tried the Skirt Steak Chile Relleno (had serious flavor!) and Chef's Daily Special:  Ensanada Burger (short rib + chuck ground beef, ham, cheese, avocado and an egg to top it off). Both were excellent but the Burger was Heavenly! Don't waste your time going to a burger restaurant when you can get this burger at Hussong's Cantina! The chips and two salsas as the free appy were very good too. Very addicting! Excellent service! Could not ask for better!

mzDJMj5Cg1aYy_q__LOGOg.text: Being a vegan I was worried about having to be in Vegas for a week for work. I packed a cooler filled with healthy food, but upon checking into my hotel i realized there was no microwave or fridge. Bummer. I ended up eating out all week and had probably my favorite meal here at Hussong's. I go to B.C., Mexico often but have never been to Hussong's down there. The food and atmosphere are Americanized but still quite good. The waiter was awesome. I asked about getting the vegetarian burrito on the menu made into tacos. He asked me if I was a vegetarian, and I said yes. Then he brings out a nice big separate menu that was all vegetarian. Cool! I went with the tacos made on pink corn tortillas (ordered without cheese or creme) and serve with rice and black beans. The beans and rice were really good, and the tacos delicious. Chips and salsa were great as well.

lUV1KEm4cl4mluSEFharFQ.text: We loved the food. The service was good and we were grateful to be seated right away. We have eaten Mexican and TexMex food while living and visiting in Texas.  The food was very good and authentic.

-d6iv8Bu1QhTPVYmDicbOg.text: Quick friendly service and good chow. Enuf said

kc_u8oRF_9RPO8eMTes-hQ.text: F A B U L O U S   M A R G A R I T A S ! ! !    I brought a group of 15 executives to Hussongs Cantina for a few Margaritas and mexican food. I never expected such a fun and welcoming experience. The service was great! We were lucky enough to have tried just about every item on the menu. Every item we tried was tasty and captured the spirit of 'the real' food in Mexico.   We started with guacamole and three salsas on the menu.  It was obvious that the guacamole and salsas were freshly made and I was in heaven from the beginning of our gastronomical experience. We continued by having all the appetizers on the menu brought in as tasters. The one thing that was immediately noticeable was the freshness of the food - OMG the corn (Elote Plazero) and the tamales were my favorites. The taste of the corn on the cob was amazing - with Cotija cheese and spicy sauce still make my mouth water - I could not get enough!. The tamal captures the authenticity of the recipes from Mexico. I am South American so their food had me from the beginning to the end. We continued by having platters with the whole variety of the tacos they serve. My favorite were the Lobster Tacos -- All of the tacos had their own unique flavor since the sauces, peppers and salsas were different depending on which taco we were having. The Nachos were huge and loaded with all the goodies you can imagine. We finished with dessert plates which had a little of each dessert on the menu -- I have to confess, by then, I just couldn't eat one more bite -- However, everyone around the table were in heaven...   We had so much fun! Our waitress was fabulous and made herself a part of our gathering as the perfect hostess. The place was jumping and music was playing ~ and our group of executives felt as if we were a friends house. Thank you Hussong's -- We will be back when in Las Vegas! Great Job...

eNWvF0tfhjGGUUyMZ3L2Kw.text: Hands down the nastiest nachos and guacamole dip I have ever had. What the hell is cheese sauce? $12 margaritas were weak. If we walked another 500 feet we would have found T&T in the Luxor.

lTT-DZSgEFlqnvE9nwxsFA.text: Not impressed, would not go back. Girl that took our order was not friendly or helpful. Overpriced !! Quality of food not good.

nZ-AjXLpLX2WkU_8Mw-POA.text: Our server was really nice, she makes this review 3 stars. The food was meh. My steak tacos were small (4 inch tortillas?). The water was nasty/chlorine-y, get a real drink. The hot sauce I asked for was awesome hot though. It had a smoked chipotle flavor with crushed up red peppers, I think.

oNG7LetWm5j4DGCIgx3uhA.text: Valentines 2/14/11  Bopped in here for a quick margarita tonight before we left the strip. I have only had a full meal here once but the burrito I had was $15 and worth every penny. The burrito was double the size of a Chipotle style and even more tasty. Margaritas are decent price for being apart of the Mandalay Bay chain as well as the authentic tacos.   Mostly a noisy bar atmosphere but well decorated with a great friendly staff.  Good place to catch a quick drink of a meal before heading out on the strip.

2u0A84wLAzwYQ2xtmZ1o9w.text: Very good. Fast, reasonable, in a good location.  We had Cesare salad and the Hussong ribeye. Very well seasoned, cooked to our request (medium) and sides were very tasty.  If you are in for a bar meal to get away...this is a very friendly spot to enjoy.

7i3ZUMflRyQzxH801CvTkg.text: Best margs in Vegas. Warm chips and two salsas. The bean dip is SO damn good. Happy hour is way worth it!!

yS3ndRwpgThB2aszM7l4Lg.text: Quickly seated. Waitress was friendly and discussed drinks with us. Checked on drink ingredients when she wasn't sure and brought sangria samples. Great margarita. Husband liked the carna asada and they have some of the best pork quesadillas I've ever had. Only reason for 4 stars was the smallish table.

5eQLWH_E8h2amSeioreUKQ.text: The mariachi they have here was awesome! Very friendly, funny, and energetic. But other then that nothing was original. Food was ok.

DDNdb4dEhQZINKkL7l80Jw.text: This was excellent food and reasonably priced for being on the strip and at the casino mall area.  I ended up eating here twice since the food was so good.  The staff was also friendly, polite, and quick.  The chips were well made, light on the oil and moderate on the salt.  The salsa was thick with nice tomato flavor that was bright, rich, and crisp.  First time I enjoyed the fish tacos. The tortillas were soft and substantial enough to not fall apart on me during my meal.  The fish had a crisp breading with a moist interior that was evenly cooked.  The lettuce was fresh and the tomatoes juicy.  The guacamole was creamy and had a small hint of lemon for freshness.  The additional bonus is that you can order an extra taco or two if you are really hungry.  The second vist I went with a pork burrito "wet" style or covered with sauce.  The burrito was large and well filled.  The pork was tender and rich in flavor that was been roasted.  There was also a crisp crust on the pork that added another dimension to the flavor.  The brown mole was thick and rich with a complex smokey flavor that blended well with the pork and the cheeses.  The rice was soft and served as a nice counterpoint to the rich mole and juicy pork.  Side dishes of beans and rice were standard but didn't stand out in my mind.  However, you don't go there for side dishes.  Overall this was excellent food and I would happily return to eat here.  I would probably even travel to get to Mandalay to eat here.

FXNcLDCs0TXhl7-3aOaaWw.text: Met up with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday and we had a great time! Our waiter was friendly and fun--even buying birthday boy a shot of tequila! Gotta love that! Food was enjoyable though not anything you haven't had before but it was satisfying enough and the drinks were kept full. Can't beat that! The mariachi band was EXCELLENT and a lot of fun. It's a little pricey but then, what isn't on the strip anymore?

WFQSD6oeQ5nEVC8abZlW4w.text: Great food, great drinks and fun atmosphere. Service was super friendly and very attentive. Will definitely hit this place again next time.

z3cSvpIpCwrsezutE4FNQg.text: Awesome food and the margaritas are just mind blowing......Try Mango Guacamole and the chips and salsa were nice........good BAJA feel.....

nPZiMNjzyCl1Cwkl_T3RCg.text: The place was a lot of fun because I was with a group of girls and comped drinks kept on coming to our table.  The service and staff were amazingly friendly.  Although I wasn't there for the food, it wasn't too bad.  In fact, I don't remember much of what I ordered but it was only from the appetizer menu.   The place does get really busy, so make sure you call for reservations.

BQ4jQPFilgzvZ15gULnvTA.text: First time at this place. Food was great. I'd definitely recommend getting the ceviche and the chicken sopes. The fish tacos we're also delicious. However unfortunately, the margaritas we're not good and I was looking forward to them. Overall, good food, poor drinks but great service. Ronnie, our server, was on point!

zOTSmTZL8olPX46ehUibfw.text: So taking our girls, ages 1 and 8 on a quick business-trip from OC to Las Vegas actually was a great 3-day trip.  On the last night we needed to get away from the strip and 104 degree temps.  We dropped the rental car off early at the airport (ok not even close to the airport but that is another Yelp review for later) and headed to Mandalay Place for dinner.  The valet guys recommended the Burger Bar but we needed a margarita or 2 so Hussong's was calling our name!  Having our girls with us, Hussong's was a great choice.  The mariacchi guys came over to play "its a small world" for our little Kelly and the experience was off to a good start.  The kids menu was great.  For adults we ordered the chicken street tacos and the beef quesadilla.  Both were excellent.  The service was pleasant but not over-bearing and the margaritas were amazing.  For a resort-area, the tab was reasonable enough.  I think we will be back!   Hopefully the mariachi guys will be there!!

9bAL12B88hRs-nyqOu___g.text: Ate here on our trip to Vegas last year using a Restaurant.com certificate. Gotta love the places that let you include liquor the coupon. We each had a large margarita that was delicious and not weak. We shared the steak nachos that were excellent. Shared a couple other appetizers that also hit the mark well. A bit small of a space and you get to know your neighbors well. Great deal with the certificate.

GDYd0XoO6wUAU0mByr12yQ.text: Love this place. Happy hour is great. The Queso Bean Dip is awesome. Love the grilled corn. Can't go wrong with the Hussongs Steak for your main course. Entertainment is so much fun. Mariachi is so much fun.

8xBR74GhkOUNmChC1wSCUg.text: Without the fun mariachi band, this place would have gotten one star.  While we were seated right away, we didn't get a server for at least twenty minutes. Even tough we did get chips and salsa, we were waiting so long for service that we went through the chips and had to serve ourselves another basket.   Once we finally flagged down a server, we got to order. The food took at least another twenty minutes to arrive. And three of us just got the quesadilla!   Now, the food. When a quesadilla is on the menu for $8, it's typically enough for a meal. The quesadilla was one corn tortilla with some cheese and like three pieces of meat. It was so small that it made the price offensive -- and it wasn't even that good!   To add to such a bad experience, three of the five people ended up with stomach aches. I would not recommend this place at all, especially given the fact that Burger Bar is next door and is about the same price.

GS9CYBe-6Ro3KY_Z_QWk5Q.text: By far the BEST chicken quesadilla and chips I've ever tasted!  Started our trip in Vegas here and ending it here

1z2nOufp7YrmKMVJF__5gA.text: Dreadful!  Went there Saturday night with a Travelzoo coupon that apparently identified us as unwelcome guests.  They sat us at the worst table ever & refused to move us even though we asked them to & there were other tables available.  We were in the middle of traffic & the table was so small that we had to put things on the floor to fit our food. The food was fair, the service was fair & the margaritas were quite tasty but I thought overpriced at $12.  The kicker was when they added an 18% tip for a party of two with no notification. We usually tip a minimum of 20% & found this insulting & a little underhanded.  We are locals & we will not be returning & will not be recommending this place.

crJbnSLvgYeKKpEWhCkbsg.text: The best dinner during our Vegas trip. The food was delicious and not expensive compared to everywhere else in Vegas. Luis was our waiter and hes was seemed to be a really nice guy. Very helpful and friendly. The food was delicious. Recommend to anyone! Also, the Mariachi Band was so funny and friendly and made everyone laugh.

n4SR2tI929EBzKz2uzYV2Q.text: Amazing happy hour deals! Vegetarian options! Thanks to Luis for being an amazing server!! Will definitely return if in Vegas again.

CEENFBv0LkZaPyZ5v5BjKw.text: Well...We have been to this place a few times. The atmosphere is great! They have a vegan menu...we love to eat healthy when we eat out, so this place is a winner. If you are in Vegas, check this little jewel out. Hey, they even serve regular food! Their margaritas are off the chain!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RI-hPaA2P3OmWR-xBfX96g.text: Love love love their vegan menu!! Had their chili relleno for the second time. Can't wait to go back!!

5Z87vSJcxncadLiWFROvVQ.text: When I come to Vegas I always look for a great place to eat and this is the spot! Being from New Mexico I was scared to eat Mexican food but hands down was I surprised! The chip and salsa started the night and the street tacos are amazing! The drinks are also fabulous!

6-NwtL80kIMo8ANeH4oZtQ.text: Quaint little spot inside the Mandalay for some Mexican yumminess!   Started off with some guacamole for the table, then shares the chicken burrito with my son. The burrito was huge, definitely enough to share.   Service was good. It wasn't very busy so we went at a good time.

94LjZetIRMqJsm0Xp7Zb2Q.text: The pork belly tacos are amazing and the staff was super friendly. The manager even gave us recommendations for other restuarants (not mexican)/attractions and offered to make a reservation for us. They also have a mariachi band and tons of TVs for football!

9Q_fPSYYxKHvyxc9DHfgeQ.text: I came here for dinner with a group of about 8 people for a work event. Being on the strip I was expecting something much more expensive but this was surprisingly affordable! It had a nice laid back environment, service could have been a bit better, we had to go up to the bar to ask for drink refills. But the food was great! I got the grilled corn which they cut off the cob for me - WIN. Then the tostada salad for dinner, I love Mexican food, so I'm easy to please!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YOr5QPRVu_kAvm7u-e5C3g.text: Can't beat this artwork! Very friendly staff. Gotta love the spongebob throwback. LEEDLE

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t beat this artwork!

s2vTKg4RbuhQFL9pdmzDCg.text: That is THE place to go in Vegas if you are close to Mandalay Bay, Luxor, etc. Make sure you come between 3pm-6pm to hit happy hour! Beer for $3,50 and THE original Margarita for $6 as well as (one) Taco for $3! We visited multiple times. The food is great for value and the Margaritas have a super taste and are VERY strong! Also our bartender "the rock" was great! 10/10 would come again.  EDIT: I forgot to mention the free nachos with two salsas that are just great and the free Tequila if you Check-In via Yelp. Also make sure to get a great T-Shirt for only $10 if you liked!!

6-6Xvhrfso6I67bMOxnYuA.text: They have delicious chips and salsa here. And $3.50 beers during happy hour! We got the Mexican corn as well and it was really good. Especially if you squeeze some lime on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L_czsEdxwLQwZitF4X81-w.text: AMBER was AMAZING!!! WOW THE ONLY BAR TENDER, and she's killing it!! 2 huge events happening,  and not a single chair open, she has her $hi down,  drinks,  food,  more drinks,  and amazing customer service!!! Your lucky to have an employee like her there 1 in a million!!!  You handled your customers like a pro, and made us have an amazing lunch!!! I've heard like 6 people tell her shes doing amazing,  and needs a raise!! I agree!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing bar tender!!!

ahiHPKYLeQgF5tNyrbQZGQ.text: The vegan menu for this place is amazing. I have attached a photo. Shared the vegan quesadillas and also had the "fish" tacos and veggie burrito. The food was wonderful, the service was good despite being understaffed. The manager was actually as the host at the front. Overall great linch and wonderful location between Mandalay Bay and Luxor.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1gYWkpN82t9MXcYEUlQHAQ.text: Great atmosphere! Great service (our server was Manny Muscles)! And great food! So glad that we checked in on Yelp and enjoyed our free Mexican corn! They took our name and number and called us when our table was ready so we could shop at the nearby Mandalay Bay shops.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

399IqqCRKO75vS3-dWdNGg.text: Excellent cuisine and amazing service. I ordered the huarache on barbacoa and it was amazing! We also ordered the $16 dollar margaritas and they were ok.

6Wi3IBS3bRc5i_p1BnM-YA.text: After walking around trying to figure out what we wanted to eat, we fell upon Hussong's. We were seated quickly and the chips and two kinds of salsa followed closely behind. Then we ordered a pitcher of Sangria.  I couldn't decide on what to order, the Tostada, Tacos or Enchiladas. I asked our server, Sandra, what she'd recommend. She said the Enchiladas, Tacos then Tostada, in that order. So I ordered the Enchiladas, one pork, one beef and one chicken, since I couldn't make my mind up!! My husband ordered the Fajitas.  We didn't wait long for our food. The Fajitas looked amazing! The steak was cooked to perfection. My Enchiladas were good, but I wouldn't order them again. The beef one was the best out of the three. They were a bit dry and they could have been hotter.  The steak from the Fajitas was DELICIOUS!  I'll order that next time The Sangria was quite tasty and we got almost three glasses each out of the pitcher. Impressive and worth the money.  The atmosphere was sports bar'ish and there were TV's on all over the place for the Stanley Cup Finals. We enjoyed that!! I'd definitely eat here again...and order the Fajitas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glass of Sangria
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pitcher of Sangria
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchiladas

15g0LioK8IXRwscOurNxQw.text: I love Mexican food and I was really excited when I found Hussong. They really didn't deliver when it came to great taste. The only things I enjoyed was the grilled corn and the margarita. The salsa was flavorless, the Chicken in the Chicken Fajitas barely had seasoning or flavor, and my boyfriend didn't enjoy his baja shrimp tacos. The service wasn't the greatest either. Food took forever to come and we felt rushed to leave. I wanted to take some chips to help me eat my leftovers since I ate all my tortilla but the busboy snatched them off the table before I could even put some in my box. For the money we spent, it wasn't worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fajitas never looked so sad in my life

5llMRKGV1NoeE6zp83YCCg.text: Great prices, good drinks, and good food. I couldn't complain about something if I wanted to!

M7jurxt0sJSWODL2RNC6Nw.text: I am SERIOUSLY boycotting Hussong's in the Boca Park shopping center. We went there for Valentine's Day and the service was disgusting. We were one of three small groups dining in. The servers chatted with each other and played with their phones right in front of us. No plates, napkins, straws, boxes for leftovers. They just hung out like they were guests, not employees. So we made a conscious decision not to leave a tip. I am a big tipper usually!! We crossed out the tip section clearly. Today, I checked my bank record and they added a $10 tip anyway. Conveniently, an unauthorized debit charge was made shortly after our trip to the restaurant to a nearby Smith's gas for $150! The bank thinks it's related. They attempted more charges, but the bank caught them. I'm just disgusted.

_Ci4ox06Do1CI8P6cvVNUg.text: Dive-y restaurant located in the upstairs of the shopping mall. Had a little trouble locating it based on my walking directions but got help from someone at the valet service.   Large menu selection, prices on the steep side. Excellent salsa trio as appetizer. Seemed that the margaritas were the specialty but was not impressed, plus it came in a beer pint glass..? Ordered the taco salad with shrimp, avocado and a delicious vinaigrette. Was a large portion so had enough for 2 meals. Friendly service. Would return.

8iPDC5dZAhoJkJDC7gjhww.text: Not going to lie, I am pretty bias when I come to a place with a dedicated Vegan menu. Add that to great service from everyone we encountered and I give this restaurant 5 stars! My sister and I split the Caesar salad and chimichanga. Plenty of food and it was delicious. We came with 2 omnivores as well and they both got steak fajitas which was a large portion and tasty to them as well. My only complaint is the music was a little loud but I was also at a day club all day so my hearing was shot, no downgrades for that.   9:30 Tequila shots added to the fun! I would definitely recommend and plan on returning on future trips to Vegas.

T6C328mA1wguNMIrSSUFAw.text: This restaurant caught our eye while we were on the hunt for good-quick food that offered football viewing. We generally love Mexican food - so this seemed like a no brainer. The huge, flat screen TVs that were playing the Hawks game didn't hurt either :)  We got seating immediately, and our friendly server, Irvin, got margaritas and chips going right away. We ordered the Carne Asada Quesidilla and the Carne Asada entree . I was blown away how tender and juicy the steak was in each dish. By far the best carne asada dish I have ever ordered from a restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stacked Quesadilla
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry frozen margarita and the Bull Dog Margarita

z-MWqASDR5elqG0y0uiTfg.text: This is where you want to be! Vibe: Chill and Festive Food: Delicious and Better than expected Drinks: Many tasty and refreshing options Service: Top notch!!!  We were lucky enough to be seated at one of Regina's tables today. The Smile. The upbeat attitude. The helpful menu suggestions. The quick and friendly service is unbeatable! She made the visit doubly enjoyable and ensures we will return.   A must when in Vegas!

ivJUsgsYezXOsVsSVRBscA.text: Wow! Love this place. We came in here before going to Happy Place and sat at the bar since we were early and wanted to grab a couple drinks before. I believe happy hour was winding down, but the bartender (wish I could remember his name!) saw we were locals and still offered it to us. We each got a margarita on the rocks.   In fact, did you know they are the home of the original margarita? Basically, the margarita was invented by them (obviously not this location, but their first one many, many years ago)! Pretty amazing to have a place like that right here in Vegas! And I could definitely tell they were the makers of the True margarita. Margs are probably my go-to drink and one of my favorites. These were so fresh and so full of flavor. I believe he used real juices in it, too. YUM!  After a few sips of our margarita, we decided to order some guac, even though it wasn't on happy hour. The guac came with chicharrones, which if you have never had them before, you will love them. They are made from pork skin. The way Hussong's Cantina flavors their chicharrones is so good! They put some kind of seasoning on top and it works super well with their guac, which by the way, was not too spicy! Which is great for me, because I hate spice haha :)  When it came time for the check, we saw that the bartender had stuck to his word and let us have our drinks at happy hour cost. He kept reiterating that they loved locals and he hoped we would come back! So kind. We will definitely be returning there!

IFoy1wSox6AlYqyUMJhC9A.text: Awesome happy hour deals hidden on the south end of the strip at the Mandalay Bay Shops. $6 Margaritas and $5 cheesy tots? Sold! Bonus for the margaritas tasting like an actual drink as if I was paying full price rather than some cheap knock off mix. The bar wasn't too crowded overall.   Check in for a free tequila shot to add into your HH margarita!   A band came out at 6 PM. Overall I would return again if I was here on a weekday during happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. August 2019

HOMxyeZNTxnAtq111MmPGQ.text: HOLY VEGAN PARADISE!  As someone who has lived in Southern California, known for its progressive nature, I had always seriously underestimated Vegas' vegan scene... BUT NOT ANYMORE! HELLO HUSSONGS!  Okay, but seriously. I went to Hussongs a few years ago and didn't remember anything spectacular but my most recent experience was nothing short of incredible.  First, not only do they have a full Vegan menu- its some of the best vegan Mexican food I've ever had!   Second, worlds best mariachi band. They were singing modern rap & country music alongside classics! It was like getting a full private concert! It was a joy to watch such talented musicians up close!  Can't say enough good things about Hussongs! They've improved 10 fold into a truly incredible restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Enchiladas!

wqx3QmPZEeio53ulX0QLYQ.text: Large Bar & Grill style.   Chips and salsa were amazing and I would highly reccomend the guacamole!   Although the atmosphere is loud and definitely feels like a bar.   If you check in on yelp you will get a free corn or free tequila shot.  Service was good, they were very busy, but the speed of removal of plates could have been better. We were a group of 5 and didn't have a lot of room when the extra plates came out.  I got the breakfast Quesadilla (vegan) and it was very dry, I was confused on where the cheese was and the eggs were on top of my tortilla not mixed inside with the soyrizo. I would not reccomend getting this.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and salsa
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My food to go
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican corn OFF the Cobb by request

44xsuHQIPE23enEBXB5qVA.text: I was not sure what to expect from this place.  I was feeling Mexican so I figured, WHY NOT!?  First, there is a Yelp check-in opportunity for a grilled corn, or a shot of tequila.  I got the corn shaved as I'm particular on my tequila, OMG, it was delicious!  It was perfectly warm with great seasonings, I used it as a dip for my chips, along with eating it as a True appetizer.   I sat at the bar and Phil helped me through my order and took good care of me.   The chips were really good, better than usual, and they came with two varieties of salsa, both were tasty.  Phil recommended the steak chile relleno as an entre, which is far from my norm, but he seemed so enthusiastic, so I went with it.  GREAT pick, it was really good and surprisingly filling.  I had a strawberry margarita which I found to be 'so, so.'  One cool aspect, they came around and served patrons free shots of tequila, and we all did a group toast.  THAT felt like Mexico, better yet, Phil hit me with an additional gratis tequila shot before I left.  Needless to say, I left fat and happy.   I really enjoyed myself sitting at the bar, even made some new friends and watched the baseball game which was on the monitors.  I will definitely go back, and I'll hope Phil is my bartender again.  Cheers amigos.

photos.caption: Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The FREE Yelp check-in item, grilled corn, which I got shaved. Filling and delicious, it pays to be part of Yelp nation.
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front view with the security gate down
Photo of Hussong's Cantina Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bartender Phil recommended the chile relleno with steak, it was on point, really good!

5MX4wR3TCd8MIMhq47WBIQ.text: Typical,  casual bar vibe, nothing fancy about it.  However,  the food is absolutely something to rave about. We strolled in half an hour before happy hour and the place was dead.  More room for us,  but seating can be a bit squeezed in when crowded.    We started out with the fried fish tacos with rice and beans. The pickled red onions,  cabbage with micro greens were the perfect combination with the deep fried goodness. The house salsa they offered were the perfect amount of heat.  They do charge extra for salsa verde.
